job description:
About the job
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

As a CRM Jr Business Analyst, your main responsibilities will include analyzing and interpreting data to inform strategic business decisions collaborating with various business areas to gather and document requirements and provide recommendations for solutions. You should have a strong understanding of CRM and be skilled in marketing, with the ability to analyze data sets to optimize sales-driven communications programs.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Be responsible for conducting A/B tests to gather insights on communications, segments, and triggers
Creating reports and presentations to communicate findings to stakeholders, such as management or other teams within the company
Analyzing customer data to identify patterns and trends, such as which products or services are most popular among different customer segments, or which customers are most likely to churn
Identifying areas where the CRM system or business processes can be improved to better engage and retain customers
You will need to identify and analyze high-value actions to increase customer value
Actively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference
You Have
1-2 years of experience in business analysis, preferably in a CRM environment
G-suite proficiency (sheets, slides) and strong Excel skills
Strong SQL skills - able to extract, manipulate, transform and analyze large volumes of data with a high level of accuracy
Strong analytical knowledge and experience with reporting, driving insights, and data-driven optimization
Strong drive for continuous improvement. Problem solving: You always find a way to get things done
Experience with visualization tools like Looker or Tableau is a plus
Good communication skills
English is a must
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing equity plan (if applicable)
Top-notch private health insurance
Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders!
Discounted gym memberships
Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time)
Enhanced parental leave including nursery support!
Online therapy and wellbeing benefit
What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly
Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openly
Stay Humble: Self-aware and open to learning
Care: Uplift people and the planet
Glownership: Act as proud owners
High Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

job description:
About the job
Who we are

About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions

of companies‚Äîfrom the world‚Äôs largest enterprises to the most ambitious

startups‚Äîuse Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and

accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the

GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That

means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy

within everyone‚Äôs reach while doing the most important work of your

career.

About The Team

Our goal is to maximise the success of Operations, both in the running

the day-to-day business and in shaping and achieving the longer term,

high effort, high value strategic priorities. We take a data-driven

approach that combines strategy, analytics and core data infrastructure

to help Ops leaders solve their most complex and most important issues

while also driving the business planning and operational cadence

end-to-end, from strategy to goal-setting to execution.

What you‚Äôll do

We are seeking a Technical Data Analyst to drive and enable business

performance in Ops‚Äô Strategy & Analytics Data foundations pillar.

‚ÄòUsers first‚Äô is Stripe‚Äôs first operating principle and in this role you

will help us understand the underlying drivers of customer interactions.

The ultimate objective is identifying product gaps, improving the

quality of our services, and making our operations more efficient.

You‚Äôll work cross-functionally with our Data Science to build and

measure Machine Learning models and Product Operations teams in creating

& maintaining data sources, building routing and case classification

systems, and communicating findings.

If you are incessantly curious, eager to solve big data challenges,

relentless, passionate about helping users, and interested in diving

into a quickly-growing team and company, we want to hear from you.

Responsibilities
Work closely with cross-functional, technical stakeholders - helping them identify and address their most impactful challenges with data and analyses
Own the development, implementation, and maintenance of Operations metrics & data sources
Partner with Data Science on the creation of machine learning models, feature generation, and ML performance monitoring
Partner with Operations and Engineering teams on the implementation of high impact data projects, championing data driven decision making

Who you are

We‚Äôre looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be

considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are

encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a

requirement.

Minimum Requirements
4+ years of experience in analytical roles
Mastery of SQL and a strong understanding of data relationships / relational databases, experience working with large datasets.
Proficiency in R, Python, or another statistical programming language
Practical experience developing and maintaining complex ETL pipelines
Proven skills in A/B testing, experiment set-up, and analysis
Experience with applied machine learning techniques
Expertise using data insights to drive business and operational goals
Outstanding analytical ability, communication, and presentation skills

Nice to have
Experience working in or with Operations, Sales, Support, or Account Management
Experience with writing and debugging data pipelines using a distributed data framework (Hadoop/Spark/Pig/etc.)
Experience with Scala
Experience working in fast-paced environments
Experience in people management or project management of cross-functional project

job description:
About the job
About YEGO

Yego was born in 2016 when shared mobility with a light vehicle was still at an experimental stage. Nowadays it is a reality and YEGO already operates in 4 Spanish cities (Barcelona, Valencia, Malaga, and Seville) and 3 French cities (Bordeaux, Toulouse and Paris). Our experience of more than 6 years in the sector, our progressive growth, and our ability to create a community with users, public actors, and private partners make YEGO a reference in Europe.

Mission

As a Data Analyst, you will support and empower Yego's departments with key data that will allow them to make strategic decisions and improve business performance.
Reporting to the Head of Vehicle Development and Data, this role is embedded in the day-to-day business performance and holds the reporting responsibilities for Yego.
The Data Analyst will be a key partner for Operations and Marketing departments providing and analyzing performance trends, user acquisition, and retention rates, rides forecast, operations performance, etc.

Responsibilities

Business KPIs reporting.
Product Analytics, tracking and reporting on the product features and improvements
Maintaining and improving the reporting and visualization outcomes
Identify, analyze and interpret trends and anomalies in the data for different departments, communicate findings
Provide insight, guidance, and recommendations to Operations and Marketing by interpreting and analyzing the business data
Discovering and exploring datasets and proposing new tracking to improve data sources and decisions
Forecasting and setting targets at the department/function level to reach objectives as well as working with the teams to see business cases for uplifts in the KPIs results

Requirements

BS degree in Data, Computer Science, Mathematics or related fields.
+ 2 years of experience in relevant roles.
Knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis techniques for both quantitative and qualitative data analysis.
Possess advanced computer skills knowledge, experience working with different databases and data warehousing understanding.
Strong knowledge of and experience with SQL (MySQL or Postgresql), and understanding of ETL programming (Python).
Expertise in statistical analysis and experience using tools to report and visualize (Tableau, R, Python, Cluvio, and others).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

job description:
About the job
Analytical engineer with experience in Data processing|Deep understanding of balancing regimes in Europe

About Our Client

One of the world's largest energy traders

Job Description

Work in a team of multiple Business and Data Analysts to validate and correct data to support business critical processes.
Keep track of the company portfolio for data management solution(s).
Collect, process, and analyse operational data (including measurement, allocation, imbalance, and reconciliation data) in order to report to internal and external stakeholders.
Troubleshoot issues with internal and external counterparties, including Asset Owners and Grid Operators.
Anomalies in generation and consumption patterns investigated and understood.
Actively manage relationships with internal and external stakeholders (including relevant market organizations)
Facilitate necessary management approvals. Work to standardise, and automate as many of these processes as possible in conjunction with IT.
Understand the deal funnel to assess and manage the workload associated with integrating new opportunities into relevant systems
Deep understanding of balancing regimes in country, well connected with regulatory bodies, able to understand upcoming regulatory changes and able to coordinate teams to implement system and process changes ahead of new introduction of new and/or changed rules.
The Successful Applicant

Be comfortable with big, complex data sets, analysis, and application of that data to drive business value.
Can process large data sets through building own queries to support and resolve complex issues and support decision making.
Show a keen interest in IT/digitalization and other technology advancements and how these can be applied to drive competitive advantage.
Excellent customer service/attention/manner.
Ability to scope and manage changes to IT projects and drive process improvements.
Have experience in regulatory reporting frameworks for Power in Europe, demonstrating an interest in balancing regimes.
Develop business relationships with customers and IT vendors.
Operate effectively as part of a team as well as autonomously.
Adapt quickly to a dynamic environment and demonstrate resilience under pressure.
Very strong interpersonal and communication skills (fluent in spoken and written English). Excellent stakeholder engagement.
Highly analytical, data driven with strong attention to detail.
Process Improvement mindset.
A basic knowledge of Trading and Supply European Power Operations, Trade Finance and Controls, European Regulatory Reporting and Compliance.
What's on Offer

Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining the company becomes an inspired career choice.

We're huge advocates for career development. We'll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.

Contact: Vivian Arriaran Vergara

job description:
About the job
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

We are looking for a passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on professional to support our Live Operations Analytics department in our headquarters in Barcelona. You will act and operate as a startup within a startup, providing both strategic thinking and analytical skills to help building excellence in Operations with focus into one specific region

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Understand the operations model in Glovo to provide advice to the different teams
Contribute to the business discussion by suggesting different and novel analysis approaches
Translate business queries into quantified & insightful reporting and KPIs to assess performance and determine the effectiveness of the implemented initiatives
Ensure scalability of the reporting
Own creation and structure of Live Operations KPIs, ensure they are properly implemented in the DDBB
Define and design dashboards to give visibility to the top-management of the Live Operations performance
Follow a data-driven decision-making process
Report to the Operations Analytics Manager
You Have
Bachelor in Engineering, Maths/Physics
1-2 years of experience working on analytics in a similar/relevant industry
Demonstrated proficiency in working with clean & optimized SQL, querying mid to large volumes of data
Consulting experience is a plus
Python is a plus
Good understanding of how to extract insights from Data Warehouses
Ability to summarize and represent data (e.g descriptive statistics and graphs)
Ability to create robust, insightful, and story-telling visualizations using modern BI & Analytics tools and ability to identify data Issues
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Comfortable working in a high growth and high performance start-up with a fast pace
Itchy feet and continuous thrive on learning through different projects
Professional English
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing equity plan (if applicable)
Top-notch private health insurance
Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders!
Discounted gym memberships
Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time)
Enhanced parental leave including nursery support!
Online therapy and wellbeing benefit
What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly
Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openly
Stay Humble: Self-aware and open to learning
Care: Uplift people and the planet
Glownership: Act as proud owners
High Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

job description:
About the job
We are currently looking for a Data Visualization to join our fast-growing team in Iberia to set of processes required to provide a solution that allows us to analyze how our business is performing. This knowledge will allow us to optimize this performance by making relevant decisions.

In this role, you will be responsible for the process of extracting, organizing, analyzing, sharing, and monitoring the information that data offers to support decision-making and business management in the healthcare world.

It will be an amazing and exciting opportunity to learn about the healthcare systems and culture and expand the solution coverage.

Do you want a job with a meaningful purpose? Do you want to make healthcare safer, better, and more reliable? Have a look at the opportunities to join our Dedalus community.

About Dedalus:

Dedalus is the leading healthcare and diagnostic software provider in Europe and one of the largest in the world with an approach focused on the continuum of care to provide complete and patient-oriented future-proof solutions to the healthcare industry.

Thanks to our portfolio of leading next-generation solutions, Dedalus covers the entire spectrum of the continuum of care, and today we support over 6,300 healthcare organizations and 5,700 labs and diagnostic centers. Our software solutions are used widely across the world, serving 540 million of population.

Today, Dedalus employs more than 6,600 highly skilled qualified people; it has the largest software R&D team in the industry in Europe representing the 38% of the overall workforce. Our company fosters a culture where employees are encouraged to learn and innovate, and to enable and enhance clinical co-operation and processes while making a meaningful difference for millions of people around the world.

We are looking for people who want to be part of our purpose-driven company and follow our vision to drive a digital-enabled healthcare ecosystem to provide better care in a healthier planet!! If you are passionate about digital technologies and want to improve healthcare delivery around the world, it is the best time to join Dedalus Spain.


About you:
Responsibilities:
Creation of ETLs
Implementation of indicators
Internal and customer data validation
Documentation

Required Skills:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent in Computer Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, or a related area of study
5-7 years experience in Data exploitation projects in the healthcare sector
2 years experience in Data exploitation projects in the healthcare sector
Ability to communicate with the client's functions
Proven experience in: health management data models; relational databases and SQL development
Visualization tool Power BI
ETL design tools (preferably Pentaho)
Desired experience in implementation of clinical processes in clinical history projects
Desired master in analytics or big data
Ability to work in a team


Why Dedalus for you?
Career development: you will have the opportunity to participate in exciting international process, have access to continuous training's programs, real internal opportunities for you to grow, and yearly performance reviews.
Healthy work and flexibility. You‚Äôll be in a company with flexible working schedule, hybrid working style and 23 vacation days per year.
Multicultural environment in a purpose-driven company. You will work on the European market leader company in digital health to contribute to transform healthcare ecosystem though cut-edge digital technologies.
Diversity and inclusion. We work every day to leverage the richness created by diverse people and teams, where the special perspective of each individual member counts.


All our jobs are open to people with disabilities.

job description:
About the job
HCLTech is an Indian-born global technology company helping companies reinvent their businesses for the digital age. HCL provides end-to-end services across industry verticals to leading companies, including 250 of the Fortune 500 and 650 of the Global 2000.

Our goal is to strengthen the brand in Spain. We are looking for an expert to work as Business Analyst!

Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled business analyst with a strong background in the finance sector, IT, Agile methodology and experience in robotic process automation (RPA) and business process management (BPM). The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving process improvements, implementing innovative solutions, and providing critical insights to support our strategic initiatives.

What you'll do:

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs, gather requirements, and develop operational solutions to address complex financial and IT challenges.
‚Ä¢ Analyse and optimize business processes through the application of RPA, BPM and any other IT solution ensuring efficiency, compliance and scalability.
‚Ä¢ Leverage Agile methodology to manage projects, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality solutions that align with business objectives.
‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain documentation, including process maps, user stories and functional specifications to ensure a clear understanding of requirements and solutions. Evaluate the success of implemented solutions, identifying areas for ongoing improvement and iteration.

Education level:

‚Ä¢University BSc. degree in finance, computer science, information systems or a related field

What do you need to know?

‚Ä¢ 3+ years of experience as a business analyst in the finance sector, with a focus on IT and process improvement.
‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of Agile methodology and project management best practices.
‚Ä¢ Exceptional analytical, problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders.

What do we value?

Intermediate English language level (B1)
Proven experience with RPA and BPM tools such as UiPath, Appian, Blue Prism, Pega or similar.

Important to note:

- If you have a valid disability certificate, Certificate of Disability in Force, please contact us.

Among HCL's principles we would like to highlight diversity and inclusion as a strength in our values and practices. We welcome and value all people, and we are committed to the inclusion and sense of belonging of each person who is part of HCL.
HCL is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

job description:
About the job
We are Aily Labs, a start-up based in Munich and in Barcelona. Aily Labs was founded in Spring 2020 and two years later we are now already a team of +120 super motivated ML Engineers, data scientists and developers.
Our mission is to build beautiful Artificial Intelligence products. We‚Äôre curious, passionate, and relentless in our drive to develop a truly end-to-end product, pushing the boundaries of innovation as far as we can.
We work in two fronts:
Our product: currently used by +10000 users. Through the use of AI, enables and simplifies the core corporate finance processes (budgeting, resource allocation, what-if, ‚Ä¶).
Our AI laboratories: we develop AI prototypes for our clients as part of their R&D initiatives. Our laboratories are diverse and aim to test state-of-the-art approaches to currently unsolved business challenges
Our data science and ML hub is based in Barcelona, we are currently a team of 30 DS & ML engineers both working from our office or remotely. We are looking for passionate data scientists to join our mission at all the levels of seniority working either remotely or in Barcelona.
In the data science team, we encourage a fun and agile environment. We contribute to the development of the brain of our products. We work in scrum, and we develop our products in our own Python packages powered by open-source ML libraries.
Role
If you have a passion for data and technology and want to join a crew of sharp analytical minds, then this may be the right opportunity for you. As a Junior data scientist, you will get a chance to take part on the typical tasks our data scientists do on a daily basis:
Translate business needs to technical requirements
Define strategy for use of data and how data use interacts with data design
Create and document reusable packages and libraries in Python and other languages
Perform data studies and data discovery around new data sources or new uses for existing data sources
Develop, train, finetune and industrialize ML models
Implement and hands-off data checking and updating procedures to other teams
Be a member of an AI laboratory performing discovery tasks and developing AI products
Develop end-to-end data science applications, including complex distributed data processing, creating an analysis framework (e.g. models, algorithms, etc.), developing custom complex visualization tools, and deploying web applications
Qualifications / Experience
1 to 3 years of experience in data science
Experience with data programming/ scripting languages (Python, R, SQL)
Experience in machine-learning methodologies (supervised /unsupervised, deep learning)
Experience performing ETL functions and understanding data quality steps
Strong in quantitative analysis, statistics, or mathematics
Experience in communicating technically, at a level appropriate for the audience
Ability to work in a fast pace and learn quickly
(Bonus) Master in Data Science /Machine Learning
(Bonus) Experience with regression modeling, forecasting, and/ or time series analysis
(Bonus) Experience with NLP
(Bonus) Experience with visualization tools (Shiny, Power BI, Tableau)
(Bonus) AWS Cloud/Azure experience/exposure
skills: Python, SQL, and Extraer, transformar y cargar (ETL)

job description:
About the job
Are you living in Spain and want to earn extra income?

Peroptyx is a provider of data and evaluation solutions used by global technology and financial enterprises to build the most locally relevant, safest and intuitive online services for their customers.

We are currently looking for freelance / independent contractors to join our community of Data Analyst in Map Applications. This role offers flexible opportunities with competitive rates. The position will allow you to work from home with a schedule that minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Data Analyst in Map Applications, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you! We are currently looking for freelancers as
Data Analyst - Map Evaluator (home office)
Part-time position, freelancer/self-employed basis, home office

The Role
¬∑ You will complete tasks related to online maps and route planning for Spain.
¬∑ You will classify/evaluate the data in relation to these tasks.
¬∑ You will use online tools to examine the accuracy of geographic queries, addresses and routes.
¬∑ To qualify for this position, you will first need to successfully complete an online entrance exam.

Ideal Candidate
Fluent in Spanish and English.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Spain
Analytical mindset.
Job Requirements
Must be living in Spain for the last 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed
All products will be provided at your own expense
Only one member per household may apply
Benefits
Work up to 20 hours per week. #homeoffice #nationwide #backtowork #
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!
Are you looking for flexible working hours? Would a second income or rewarding experience come in handy as a career booster? Then apply now!

This is a freelance, independent contractor position.

job description:
About the job
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ‚ú®

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing
Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions

What You'll Need
Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge

Nice to have
Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++‚Ä¶)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming

Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

job description:
About the job
Beam Suntory is Crafting the Spirits that Stir the World. Rooted in two centuries of family heritage, Beam Suntory has evolved into the world's third largest leading premium spirits company ... where each employee is treated like family and trusted with legacy. With our greatest assets - our premium spirits and our people - we're driving growth through impactful marketing, innovation and an entrepreneurial spirit. Beam Suntory is a place where you can come Unleash your Spirit by making an impact each and every day.

Digital Analyst eCommerce

The following position is open in Madrid, Spain.

What makes this a great opportunity?

Beam Suntory recently entered an amazing race, sailing bravely through the exciting waves of the digital ocean. In typical Beam Suntory fashion, we just "go for it", Yatte Minahare! We're entrepreneurial, agile, dynamic and friendly, and love having fun on and off the job! The role is a fantastic opportunity to have a tangible impact, building the digital analytics capability within the regional eCommerce and Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) business unit (eMU). As well as gain experience in the exciting spirits industry and fast-paced Digital Commerce channel. All in all, a fantastic "learn, apply and deliver" opportunity for any ambitious self-starter.

Role Responsibilities

Develop the digital analytics capability within the eCommerce and D2C business unit (eMU), to support the delivery of 2023 targets and enable Beam Suntory‚Äôs growth ambition
Work closely with the D2C team to build full-funnel analytics capabilities. Set the benchmark for 360 digital analyses on marketing activations (owned, earned and paid channels), and identify new opportunities for growth through CLV and CAC optimization
Collaborate with core eMU functions, and Local Marketing, Media and Commercial teams to enable and optimize our funnels, programs, marketing channels, and campaigns through marketing analytics-informed insights
Be the ambassador of Growth Marketing within the organization, driving internal education, establishing the mindset (data and experimentation), and embedding the corresponding frameworks (process and funnel wise)
Lead Success & Knowledge sharing (learning platform), standardizing frameworks for measurement, best practices and how-to-guides across eSearch, eContent and eShopper, ensuring learnings are translated into relevant business recommendations
Support Annual Planning (1y) and Growth Planning (3y) process, regarding marketing spend and contribution based on analytics of prior performance
Own roadmap of pilots and new tools to test (learning platform) across the eMU marketing team
Collaborate and feedback eData and Global reports to help improve performance measurement and preserve data quality. Proactively input processes that can be improved with better analytics using existing data
Champion performance enhancement projects, such as brand investment (BI) effectiveness and attribution modelling
Guide IT team on systems/tools/martech needed to optimize marketing performance, track customer behavior, or enhance customer experience
Liaise with Global IT, Global Insights, Global Digital Commerce, Global Brand House Digital teams, and Local Markets to ensure the successful development and integration of the digital analytics capability in the organization

Qualifications & Experience

Qualifications and experience:
5+ years proven experience in similar role (digital analytics or growth marketing work)
Knowledge of digital marketing (and its metrics) across website and owned media as well as search (organic and paid), social, display, and programmatic platforms
Knowledge of web analytics (social and search, paid and organic), CRO, experiment design and full funnel marketing
Superior Analytical skills, data-driven mindset, and process oriented
Ability to structure business problems into data analytics plans, and analytics output into actionable insight and business strategies
Test & learn experience, piloting projects and sharing best practices
Think big and have a growth mindset and love to turn data into insight
Learning agility, curiosity and always up to date (trends, tools, techniques, etc)
Ability to operate simultaneously and effectively in both tactical and strategic modes
Professional proficiency in English
Capable of building effective and collaborative work relationships
Excellent communicator, can explain complex problems simply
Able to manage multiple projects, highly organized and detail-oriented
Willingness to lead, own and roll up sleeves to get things done
Self-starter with an ability to deal with ambiguity in a new role
Software requirements:
Google Analytics certification (GA4 preferred)
Knowledge Semrush, Similar Web, and Supermetrics
Data visualization/reporting tools such as PowerBi, Google Data Studio
Experience working with a CDP and email marketing tool (SFMC)


Preferred Qualifications:

(Traditional) Marketing background would be an asset
P&L understanding and (traditional) business KPIs (market share)
Experience working in a start-up where you had to define best practices
Experience in marketing research and statistical analysis
Experience in the alcoholic beverages industry a plus
Software engineering, automation, machine learning knowledge valuable

At Beam Suntory, people are our number one priority, and we believe our people grow together in diverse and inclusive environments where their unique insights, experiences and backgrounds are valued and respected. Beam Suntory is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, military veteran status and all other characteristics, attributes or choices protected by law. All recruitment and hiring decisions are based on an applicant‚Äôs skills and experience.

You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Spain
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

job description:
About the job
Our offer
The Role
Hybrid Intelligence, a Capgemini Engineering team, is looking for a Data Science junior to join the team in Spain . You will work with a highly talented team, while participating in the rapid growth and expansion of our client base.
Requirements
To succeed in this role, you should have:
A Masters or PhD in operations research, computer science, mathematics or engineering.
A genuine enthusiasm for using data science to solve complex problems, and an understanding of the algorithms, data processing methods and visualization techniques required.
Professional level ability in Spanish and English.
About Us
As a member of the Hybrid Intelligence team of Capgemini Engineering you will work on a variety of innovative and rewarding projects that make a difference. Our work is a fusion of applied mathematics, scientific computing, AI, and software engineering. We deliver ground-breaking, multi-disciplinary solutions for our R&D-driven clients tackling humanity‚Äôs generational challenges, from discovering new drug treatments to harnessing green energy.
We are dedicated to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We appreciate individuals for who they are and value the diversity they bring to the workplace.
Capgemini Engineering is an integral part of the Capgemini Group, a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. It is a multicultural company of over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries.

What we offer?
Permanent working contract
Remote working.
Flexible schedule + intensive workday on Fridays and in summer (almost three months)
Social benefits package (private medical insurance, life and accident insurance paid by the company, Gympass, Life -employment and family assistance company-, etc).
Flexible remuneration (transport ticket, restaurant ticket, nursery, training, extend health insurance to your family...)
Ongoing technical, skills and language training (free English classes for all employees)
Annual performance evaluations. Professional development plan, based on your experience and future potential, adapted to you, with both horizontal and vertical growth.

job description:
About the job
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com

We are hiring freelance English and Spanish speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in English and Spanish
You must be living in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Spain
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?
Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative
Remote work & Location Independence
Be your own boss
Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle
Be a part of an online community

About the job
Our Company

Llevamos desde 2014 innovando y trabajando en sectores tan exigentes como la automoci√≥n. Como te imaginar√°s -y si no, te lo contamos- el sector industrial es un sector complejo y competitivo con continuos cambios y estar al d√≠a en innovaci√≥n digital es muy importante para las empresas industriales.

Para Alhona es importante que entiendas el impacto de lo que est√°s desarrollando en la sociedad, los usuarios y clientes, y que cuando lo hagas, quieras aportar valor en cada una de las l√≠neas de c√≥digo que programas.

Ser√°s responsable de dise√±ar y construir una plataforma de procesamiento de datos que pueda manejar grandes cantidades de datos y transformarlos en diferentes formatos para su consumo por parte de otros productos internos.

Realizar√°s sesiones de pair-programming y mob-programming con tus compa√±eros/as buscando aprender y ense√±ar tanto en desarrollo como en data.

Ser√°s una pieza clave en la cultura de equipo y visi√≥n de Producto de Alhona.

¬øQu√© esperamos de ti?
Ya ves, por lo que te contamos, que por encima de todo buscamos a una persona de equipo, con conocimientos s√≥lidos y que disfrute creando productos desde cero. Necesitamos ese esp√≠ritu proactivo, din√°mico y de entrega continua.

Si quieres ir ‚Äúa por el bote‚Äù, ser√° ideal que:
Hayas trabajado en un entorno startup.
Speaking in English is something you like and you don‚Äôt mind using it at work. Como estar√°s sospechando, si te defiendes en ingl√©s, sumar√°s puntos.

¬øQu√© beneficios tiene trabajar en Alhona?
‚åö Horario flexible con 4 horas de solape con el resto del equipo (core-hours), jornada continua los viernes y 3 meses en verano.

job description:
About the job
TELUS International is looking for Language Data Analysts in Barcelona, Spain to work onsite for a machine learning project! At the moment, we are looking for candidates with fluency in Finnish, Danish or Norwegian . For this position, we also offer relocation assistance .

Language Data Analysts will analyze data in a given language and identify potential issues. They will also collaborate with international testing teams and engineers to help reproduce issues and test features. Data obtained will be used to train and improve speech recognition and AI systems.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Includes, but is not limited to the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Linguistic data labelling.
Analyzing language data in the given language and identifying potential issues and patterns.
Collaborating with an international testing team and engineers to help reproduce issues and test features.
Communicating with various departments.

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:

Fluency in Finnish, Danish or Norwegian .
Preferred educational background: linguistics, literature or translation.
Available to work onsite in Barcelona, Spain.
Excellent reading, writing and comprehension skills in English; ability to understand and closely follow elaborate guidelines in English.
In-depth knowledge of native culture and history, staying up to date with day-to-day news and happenings in the target country and regular use of the language required.
Strong attention to detail and ability to meet project targets.
Self-motivated and able to work as part of the team or independently.
Good computer and software skills across different operating systems.
Strong typing skills.
Good organizational skills

Referral program with attractive bonuses

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

job description:
About the job
Who We Are:
AKDM is a leader in delivering digital growth strategies guided by data, analytics, and business intelligence. We work with a range of clients ‚Äî spanning niche players to industry leaders across e-commerce, financial services, travel, entertainment, and consumer packaged goods.

Inclusivity for our teams is a priority. From DEI training to volunteering, we are on a journey to connect our business goals with values by promoting a culture of equity and access. We are actively seeking candidates that bring diverse perspectives to our team and work with us to build better, more inclusive approaches to work and collaboration.

About the Role:
As a Web Analyst, designing and implementing tracking solutions doesn‚Äôt intimidate you. You thrive in this role when you‚Äôre able to track across a wide variety of platforms, collaborate with teams across disciplines, and help establish a data-driven culture of measurement. Your passion for figuring out better ways to track key user actions that directly impact ROI provides the basis for many crucial downstream processes; complex analysis, data products, and measurement of digital marketing performance.


Responsibilities:
Develop measurement best practices and technology requirements to generate high quality, easily-understood implementation guides for deployments of analytics implementations.
Partner with client engineering teams to audit analytics implementations, troubleshoot tracking issues, and define quality assurance tests to optimize reporting effectiveness.
Collaborate closely with AKDM‚Äôs digital marketing teams to enhance tracking capabilities and ensure that data is accurately tracked through all pipelines and reporting endpoints.
Serve as the resource for setting up new analytics implementations, defining how they are similar, and how they are radically different to internal and external teams.
Actively focus on the future-proofing, scalability, and ease of maintenance in all analytics implementations.
Maintain a repository of high quality technical deliverables, methodologies and business development documents.
Stay up to date with industry trends (such as iOS14 and server-side tagging) within the analytics space.

Competencies:
Undergraduate degree or any equivalent combination of education and experience.
1-2 years of analytics implementation with an understanding of the digital marketing or ad tech space (i.e. attribution models, feed based marketing, pixel based marketing).
Comprehensive knowledge of JavaScript and an understanding of popular libraries and frameworks to enhance analytics deployment.
Understanding of common data layer methodology, designing a cohesive data model (data layer) and interpreting a solution design document.
Extensive experience with analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, and Amplitude.
Extensive experience with marketing and advertising engines such as Facebook, Google (Ads, CM360, SA360), Bing, Tiktok, Pinterest, Snapchat, Twitter, Reddit, and Criteo.
Extensive experience with tag management systems such as Google Tag Manager, Tealium, or Dynamic Tag Management.
Familiarity with deploying and testing analytics tools in mobile apps for iOS and Android devices, especially using the Firebase SDK.
Proven critical thinking, analytical problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to bridge the gap between technology and business management.
Familiarity with web technologies and website infrastructure (data layers, HTTP protocol, DevTools, cookies, client/server interactions, asynchronous website, etc..).
Ready to be part of a tight-knit, growing team; ambitious, can work independently as well as collaboratively and possess interpersonal skills.

Nice to Haves:
Experience with front-end development, including customizing templates for popular content management platforms such as WordPress, Shopify, Magento, Drupal, and more.
Experience with one or more data visualization tools, including Tableau, PowerBI, or Data Studio.
You love to figure out ways to automate work processes and have some familiarity with SQL.
Experience working in a startup environment with exceptional multi-tasking and context-switching capabilities.

What We Provide For Spain Employees:
Funded Pension Plan
30 calendar days for PTO
13th & 14th month salary
Holidays: We observe all major Spain holidays and encourage our employees to celebrate their cultural and ethnic traditions without having to take PTO
Paid Parental Leave: We provide 16 weeks paid leave for primary caregivers
Mentorship Program: Mentees receive one-on-one support from the leadership team to receive practical advice and guidance in developing future career goals
Flexible work from home policy


What We Value:
At AKDM we believe diversity is essential to crafting digital strategies. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, ethnicity, citizenship, national origin of employees, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected status.

job description:
About the job
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

As a CRM Jr Business Analyst, your main responsibilities will include analyzing and interpreting data to inform strategic business decisions collaborating with various business areas to gather and document requirements and provide recommendations for solutions. You should have a strong understanding of CRM and be skilled in marketing, with the ability to analyze data sets to optimize sales-driven communications programs.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Be responsible for conducting A/B tests to gather insights on communications, segments, and triggers
Creating reports and presentations to communicate findings to stakeholders, such as management or other teams within the company
Analyzing customer data to identify patterns and trends, such as which products or services are most popular among different customer segments, or which customers are most likely to churn
Identifying areas where the CRM system or business processes can be improved to better engage and retain customers
You will need to identify and analyze high-value actions to increase customer value
Actively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference
You Have
1-2 years of experience in business analysis, preferably in a CRM environment
G-suite proficiency (sheets, slides) and strong Excel skills
Strong SQL skills - able to extract, manipulate, transform and analyze large volumes of data with a high level of accuracy
Strong analytical knowledge and experience with reporting, driving insights, and data-driven optimization
Strong drive for continuous improvement. Problem solving: You always find a way to get things done
Experience with visualization tools like Looker or Tableau is a plus
Good communication skills
English is a must
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing equity plan (if applicable)
Top-notch private health insurance
Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders!
Discounted gym memberships
Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time)
Enhanced parental leave including nursery support!
Online therapy and wellbeing benefit
What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly
Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openly
Stay Humble: Self-aware and open to learning
Care: Uplift people and the planet
Glownership: Act as proud owners
High Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

job description:
About the job
About YEGO

Yego was born in 2016 when shared mobility with a light vehicle was still at an experimental stage. Nowadays it is a reality and YEGO already operates in 4 Spanish cities (Barcelona, Valencia, Malaga, and Seville) and 3 French cities (Bordeaux, Toulouse and Paris). Our experience of more than 6 years in the sector, our progressive growth, and our ability to create a community with users, public actors, and private partners make YEGO a reference in Europe.

Mission

As a Data Analyst, you will support and empower Yego's departments with key data that will allow them to make strategic decisions and improve business performance.
Reporting to the Head of Vehicle Development and Data, this role is embedded in the day-to-day business performance and holds the reporting responsibilities for Yego.
The Data Analyst will be a key partner for Operations and Marketing departments providing and analyzing performance trends, user acquisition, and retention rates, rides forecast, operations performance, etc.

Responsibilities

Business KPIs reporting.
Product Analytics, tracking and reporting on the product features and improvements
Maintaining and improving the reporting and visualization outcomes
Identify, analyze and interpret trends and anomalies in the data for different departments, communicate findings
Provide insight, guidance, and recommendations to Operations and Marketing by interpreting and analyzing the business data
Discovering and exploring datasets and proposing new tracking to improve data sources and decisions
Forecasting and setting targets at the department/function level to reach objectives as well as working with the teams to see business cases for uplifts in the KPIs results

Requirements

BS degree in Data, Computer Science, Mathematics or related fields.
+ 2 years of experience in relevant roles.
Knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis techniques for both quantitative and qualitative data analysis.
Possess advanced computer skills knowledge, experience working with different databases and data warehousing understanding.
Strong knowledge of and experience with SQL (MySQL or Postgresql), and understanding of ETL programming (Python).
Expertise in statistical analysis and experience using tools to report and visualize (Tableau, R, Python, Cluvio, and others).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Good communication and presentation skills, as well as utilize data obtained and analysed, performed to guide the business performance

Perks

Participating in changing mobility for good into a cool, hassle-free, and environmentally-friendly experience.
Working with a young and passionate team, towards the same goals.
A modern workspace in Poblenou with a games area and indoor patio.
Free fruit, snacks, coffee and tea at the office.
Private Health Insurance (Cigna).
Gym membership discounts (AndJoy).
Unlimited use of Yego vehicles.
Flexible retribution plan (Cobee).
Flexible working hours and remote working conditions.

YEGO is proud of being an equal-opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age, or ability.

About the job
Do you want to be part of a leading international company in offering solutions to the hospitality industry?

MAKRO (it is a subsidiary of the METRO Group), whose objective is to bring distribution within the HoReCa sector to its maximum level, taking advantage of the advantages offered by digitalization or the delivery service, always maintaining the focus on the client and success of your business.

‚Ä¢ Support the Pricing area in the implementation of a consistent reporting flow (through MicroStrategy) with relevant information for the department's decision-making.
‚Ä¢ Being used to handling information for the construction of KPIs related to the domain of pricing such as: index price, Gross Profit Margin, share of sales, Market Price ‚Ä¶etc

‚Ä¢ Have experience in the creation of datamarts and work with large volumes of data for the generation of optimal reporting.

job description:
About the job
About HP

HP is the world‚Äôs leading personal systems and printing company, we create technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere. Our innovation springs from a team of individuals, each collaborating and contributing their own perspectives, knowledge, and experience to advance the way the world works and lives.

We are looking for visionaries, like you, who are ready to make a purposeful impact on the way the world works.

At HP, the future is yours to create!

HP‚Äôs Industrial Print Business (IP) works to deliver large scale cloud solutions that enable on demand manufacturing of personalized goods around the world. Our products lead the market with a strong focus on technology, scalability, and security. We are working to disrupt industries such as publishing, by bringing to physical world, personalized content that today only exist in a digital way. As part of this disruption, we help Print Service Providers streamline the manufacture of books, business cards, packaging, photos, posters, signage and almost anything else that can be printed.

The IPS (Industrial Print Services Business) WW Current Business Management team is a team of young and talented professionals that are responsible for planning, forecasting, and analysing business plans (long and short term) and provide guidance, based on analysed business trends and directions, for decision making within the above mentioned business.

We are now looking for a Junior WW Business and Data Analyst to support this team.

Job Role And Responsibilities
In accordance with plan and team guidance, performs/executes data collection and analysis procedures and data insight visualizations for assigned projects.
Collects, records, and analyses data using established protocols and processes; communicates findings to other team members for review and feedback.
Utilize historical data to perform requirements analysis and identify trend lines across several data sources within the organization to support decisions
Apply predictive analysis and tools to forecast and employ business analytics (including an enhanced ability to quantify and qualify data)
Utilize the Business Intelligence analytics database to carry out statistical analysis and ad hoc reporting as required
Assures accuracy, integrity, and compliance of cleansed data.
Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Assists in preparation of literature and presentations for peer review, publication, and delivery at industry and scientific events and conferences; creates patent applications and supporting documentation.
Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.
Education And Experience Required
Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent experience
Less than 3 months extracurricular experience.
Excellent English skills, written and spoken
Knowledge And Skills Required
Demonstrated analytical thinking, technical analysis, and data manipulation skills
Ability to learn and draw on new analytical techniques
Basic knowledge of research methodology
Demonstrated knowledge of Excel, Access, statistical analysis, and financial modeling
Developing business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Basic understanding of project management methodology
Knowledge on Power BI, or additional databases such as SQL Server and MySQL is preferred. It is also preferable to be familiar with data warehousing, data mining, and data mapping.
About HP

You‚Äôre out to reimagine and reinvent what‚Äôs possible‚Äîin your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what‚Äôs next. We‚Äôre in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion ‚Äì it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you‚Äôre more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

job description:

Peroptyx is a provider of data and evaluation solutions used by global technology and financial enterprises to build the most locally relevant, safest and intuitive online services for their customers.

We are currently looking for freelance / independent contractors to join our community of Data Analyst in Map Applications. This role offers flexible opportunities with competitive rates. The position will allow you to work from home with a schedule that minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Data Analyst in Map Applications, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you! We are currently looking for freelancers as

¬∑ You will complete tasks related to online maps and route planning for Spain.
¬∑ You will classify/evaluate the data in relation to these tasks.

job description:
About the job
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

Join us and become a key member of Glovo's Global operations team! We offer a challenging and dynamic environment with many opportunities for learning and development.

The couriers are the key player in Glovo‚Äôs marketplace. We are looking for an Analyst (Courier Growth) who will find the balance between creativity and data-driven objectivity in such a way that they carry out projects that seem impossible until they come true.

You will be in charge of providing data into the marketing initiatives of the courier growth team, from the moment the leads (courier candidates) see an advertisement till they register into our acquisition page and become couriers. Through analytics you will ensure that we always have the right amount of leads in every city.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Provide analytical support to the team of more than 20 countries, regional and local teams throughout deeper understanding of Glovo's operations model
Perform analysis to come up with insights to help improve KPIs in all the leads around the world
Understand and fix data reliability issues
Build tools and processes, to understand which channels give us the best quality leads
Help performance marketing department to adopt a data driven approach
Pull, understand and analyze all our performance marketing ads experiments
Own dashboards and build new tools to improve the visibility of metrics in the department
Understand which are the best top of funnel strategies
Develop analytical frameworks and models for the area and be able to instruct and communicate for all the department
Understand and deep-dive into the data to understand the reasons and the levers we can act upon to improve KPIs (and be accountable for them)
Evaluate strategic opportunities, performing a broad range of quantitative analyses and A/B tests
Contribute towards the continuous improvement of the Glover acquisition through out-of-the-box thinking
Understand local and regional needs, and put yourself in the skin of the courier - understand who they are
You Have
Bachelor in Engineering, Maths or any technological domain
Passionate about analytics: you enjoy deep diving into problems to find the root cause
Problem-solving skills: no problem is too small or too big
Excel / Google Sheets proficiency
Proficient in SQL and Python
JavaScripts is a plus
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, Data Studio & Qlikview
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills (English is a must)
Proactive, organized, and obsessed with details
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing equity plan (if applicable)
Top-notch private health insurance
Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders!
Discounted gym memberships
Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time)
Enhanced parental leave including nursery support!
Online therapy and wellbeing benefit
What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly
Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openly
Stay Humble: Self-aware and open to learning
Care: Uplift people and the planet
Glownership: Act as proud owners
High Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

job description:
About the job
Data Specialist / BI Analyst

Location: Madrid, Spain

(This role is office based in the Mindray Madrid office Monday to Friday / full time)

Highly Competitive Salary + Excellent Benefits + Career Enhancement

Reporting to National Operations Manager, Spain

Are you a data guru, fluent in Spanish and English (and preferably Mandarin, but not essential!), well versed in BI tools, data analysis, business performance and reporting looking to have immediate impact on a business in exponential growth ‚Äì if so, we have a newly created opportunity you will love! To achieve our ambitious growth targets, we have fostered a culture of data driven innovation and product development.

Working with our highly successful Spanish team, based in Madrid, you will have outstanding commercial analytical skills, a comprehensive working experience of tools such as Tableau, or similar BI tools and will join our fun, highly professional, experienced team, to truly shape how we use our data to the fullest. This is an opportunity to really drive the success in Spain, so your impact will be significant.

Your Responsibilities

Provide business data analytics and sales analytics reports that allow stakeholders and executives team to make informed decisions
Facilitate the regional management leaders to conduct business reviews and proactive op portunity management that can improve the visibility of sales pipeline

Provide support to internal stakeholders on BI functionality and data content within dashboard

Identify innovative workflow efficiencies and propose improvements to enhance data quality and timeliness

What are we looking for in you?

Proven comprehensive experience of BI tools / data analysis tools ‚Äì Tableau, BI, Visual Basic or similar
Background in a data analysis, commercial data, BI based role
Fluent in Spanish and ENGLISH ‚Äì both written and spoken
Ideally you will be fluent in Mandarin, this is not a mandatory requirement, but helpful!

Ability work in Spain without the requirement of company sponsorship

What‚Äôs in it for you?

This is an excellent position for candidates that are really looking for a role with difference and one in which they can really make an impact. As a double-digit growth business with ambitious targets in our meteoric success, this is an opportunity to join a business built for future success where you can have a true impact on our business, and your own career development!
