job description:
About the job
Clarity AI‚Äôs mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.

We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK, and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

We are currently looking for a Data Strategy Manager to support our team for a temporary period of about, 6 months.

The role provides an opportunity to contribute to the mission of Clarity while working in a multicultural, flexible, and fast-paced environment.

LOCATION
Madrid or remote

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Do the quarterly reporting to data vendors by using Salesforce
Support to legal on data rights: you will support our team on all the questions related to data rights, and you will be in close collaboration with our legal team to asses them in the best way
Ongoing conversations with Data Providers: you will play a key role in the discussions with our different data providers
Establishes and develops trusted partnerships and relationships
Understand the decision-making process, workflows, and business and information needs of business unit heads, service managers, and owners
Understands how in-depth analysis of voluminous datasets enables the discovery of new insight that improves decision-making processes and operational effectiveness
Collaborate with partners across lines of businesses and functions, navigating the organization and figuring out who is needed to get things done. You will use your influence skills to establish a strong sense of working together towards a shared vision and goals.
Engage business leaders/staff and technology leaders/staff in an end-to-end process to understand and communicate data management capabilities to support solutions
Apply problem-solving techniques to determine business impact and strategic option


Requirements:
Business or Engineering Degree
At least 3 years of experience at a similar position
Ability to read and understand contracts with Data Vendors
Understand how contracts affect the products
Propose solutions to the requests that allow to remain compliant and address the business need
Business oriented person, with deep attention to details
Strong communication skills, with proven negotiation skills


Benefits:
Our people are our main asset. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values:
Our team comprises professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools.
Clarity‚Äôs Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by an excellent leadership team coming from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences.
We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:
Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions.
Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences.
Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time.
Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best.
Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles).
Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. Thats why we created our own ERG groups.
Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).
To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.
By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.
We care about our employees and think they deserve the best.
ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That‚Äôs why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options.
Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget.
Additional benefits are available depending on your location.
We are a US company with a UK and Spanish subsidiary. We have offices in New York City, London and Madrid and have possibilities for remote working for many of our roles.

job description:
About the job
CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the world‚Äôs biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact.
What does that mean for you? You‚Äôll join an international organization big enough to take you anywhere, and small enough to get you there sooner. You‚Äôll help change how goods get to market and contribute to global sustainability. You‚Äôll be empowered to bring your authentic self to work and be surrounded by diverse and driven professionals. And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our Hybrid Work Model.

Act as the key business support for the dedicated business units with revenue budgeting, forecasting, reporting, pricing, and profitability projects. Responsibility for Iberia

Position purpose:
Prepare monthly management reporting packages per product & country with relevant management commentary
Prepare country pack presentations
Partner with Country General Managers and Commercial Teams in evaluating new business opportunities in dedicated business units
Supporting the adoption of standard finance tools and processes
Combining FP&A data analytics with business insights to produce accurate budgets and forecasts and clearly measure and communicate performance against these
Perform customer profitability review
Analyze and identify the reasons for variations
Control and analysis of direct costs of dedicated business units.
Participation in current department projects and other tasks

Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance / Business Administration or equivalent.

Experience:

3+ years of Finance experience preferably for complex multinational businesses, with Commercial and Supply Chain Finance expertise


Skills and Knowledge
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Established financial, commercial and strategic analysis skills
Base level financial modeling skills (DCF Analysis, scenario analysis, business case development, business valuations, and operational modelling)
Commercial acumen with demonstrated strength in solving both structured and unstructured problems
Advanced Word / Excel / PowerPoint skills
Exceptional interpersonal skills to enable the effective management of stakeholders
Ability to work both autonomously and collaboratively to deadlines and without supervision
English and Spanish.

job description:
About the job
Description

Clarity AI‚Äôs mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.
We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

We are looking for an Associate - Data Research that will help us build a reliable and scalable database of sustainability information, through research on public companies‚Äô ESG indicators and quality assurance. The role provides an opportunity to understand the reporting standards that exist and how companies‚Äô sustainability performance is measured.

LOCATION:
Madrid or remote

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Working as an Associate - Data Research you will be responsible for ensuring that we have the most accurate environmental, social and governance data in order to provide the most reliable sustainability impact measurements. The Associate - Data Research role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities:
Assist in data collection project management through data analysis, quality assurance and data monitoring using BI, Excel, SQL and Python
Conduct frequent research on ESG reporting standards and assist in the development of methodologies for the collection of environmental indicators (e.g. CO2 emissions, energy consumption, waste generation)
Mentor and train external contractors and internal team on environmental indicators and sustainability frameworks
Perform ad hoc team projects as needed


Requirements:
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)
At least a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Sustainability, Finance, Economics, International Relations, Accounting, Environmental Studies or similar field of study
2+ years of experience in a related field (company fundamentals analysis, sustainability, data collection, data analysis, data research, consulting, auditing)
Basic knowledge of Python and/or SQL
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Excel, and BI tools (e.g. Quicksight, Tableau)
Prior/working knowledge of ESG research or analysis is an advantage
Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills, with clear attention to detail and ability to work with complex datasets
Highly motivated, independent, proactive and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact

*Only CVs in English will be taken into account

job description:
About the job
JR0114179

Data Analysis - Product Performance Associate ) ‚Äì Madrid, Spain

Are you ready to play a pivotal role using your analytical skills to ensure growth and success across our Financial Ecosystem in Europe? Do you have a passion for innovation and for using data to drive commercial success? If so, why not consider joining Western Unions‚Äô new Digital Banking hub as a Data Analysis - Product Performance Associate .

Western Union powers your pursuit.

In this unique role for the new pan-European Ecosystem you will play a critical role in ensuring the success of our digital banking product by tracking and analyzing performance metrics, identifying trends and opportunities for improvement, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive product optimization.

Role Responsibilities
Using a wide range of data, you will be identifying trends and insights to inform product optimization and growth strategies.
You will collaborate with Product Management Team to establish performance metrics and KPIs for our digital banking product.
You will work with cross-functional teams, including product, marketing, and technology, to identify and prioritize product improvements and enhancements.
You will conduct market research and competitor analysis to stay up to date with industry trends and best practices.
You will communicate product performance insights and recommendations to key stakeholders and partners, and you will have an active role in the product reporting cycles.
Role Requirements
For this important role you will have 5+ years of professional experience in data analysis, performance analysis or a related field, although candidates with other relevant experience will be considered.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills with experience using data to inform decision-making.
You have excellent communication and collaboration skills and the ability to work independently and in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
=
You demonstrate experience with mobile and web tools, and experience in digital banking propositions, market trends, and the competitve landscape.
A strong academic background including qualifications (or equivalence in experience) in Business Administration, Economics, Marketing or Technology, or a related field is advantageous.
Excellent written and spoken English and Spanish are essential and all other language skills are welcomed.
We make financial services accessible to humans everywhere. Join us for what‚Äôs next.

Western Union is positioned to become the world‚Äôs most accessible financial services company ‚Äîtransforming lives and communities. To support this, we have launched a Digital Banking Service and Wallet across several European markets to enhance our customers‚Äô experiences by offering a state-of-the-art digital Ecosystem. More than moving money, we design easy-to-use products and services for our digital and physical financial ecosystem that help our customers move forward.

Just as we help our global customers prosper, we support our employees in achieving their professional aspirations. You‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and build a career, as well as receive a great compensation package. If you‚Äôre ready to help drive the future of financial services, it‚Äôs time for Western Union. Learn more about our purpose and people at https://careers.westernunion.com/

Benefits

You will also have access to short-term incentives, multiple health insurance options, accident and life insurance, and access to best-in-class development platforms, to name a few

(https://careers.westernunion.com/global-benefits/). Please see the location-specific benefits below and note that your Recruiter may share additional role-specific benefits during your interview process or in an offer of employment.

Your Spain Specific Benefits Include
25 days annual leave ‚Äì plus 14 public holidays
Comprehensive life & medical cover ‚Äì including dependents.
Contributory pension plan
Preventative Care Assistance program
We are passionate about diversity. Our commitment is to provide an inclusive culture that celebrates the unique backgrounds and perspectives of our global teams while reflecting the communities we serve. We do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, religion, political affiliation, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, or veteran status. The company will provide accommodation to applicants, including those with disabilities, during the recruitment process, following applicable laws.

About the job
Do you want to be part of a leading international company in offering solutions to the hospitality industry?

MAKRO (it is a subsidiary of the METRO Group), whose objective is to bring distribution within the HoReCa sector to its maximum level, taking advantage of the advantages offered by digitalization or the delivery service, always maintaining the focus on the client and success of your business.

-Work with BI and Pricing team to Harmonize / rationalize the company extensive data Pricing pipelines (ELT process) to maximize the data model and optimize the delivery of the reporting layer.
-Work together with Commercial (Pricing & Purchasing) in the definition and design of the Pricing 360¬∫ reporting.
-Design of KPIs and Dashboards to help the area in decision making (activation): index price, Gross Profit Margin, share of sales, Price elasticity of demand.
-Work with stakeholders including the Managers and business users to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data solution needs.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Be a leading force supporting the Data Manager in:

About the job
Description

Clarity AI‚Äôs mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.
We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

We are looking for an Associate - Data Research that will help us build a reliable and scalable database of sustainability information, through research on public companies‚Äô ESG indicators and quality assurance. The role provides an opportunity to understand the reporting standards that exist and how companies‚Äô sustainability performance is measured.

LOCATION:
Madrid or remote

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Working as an Associate - Data Research you will be responsible for ensuring that we have the most accurate environmental, social and governance data in order to provide the most reliable sustainability impact measurements. The Associate - Data Research role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities:
Assist in data collection project management through data analysis, quality assurance and data monitoring using BI, Excel, SQL and Python
Conduct frequent research on ESG reporting standards and assist in the development of methodologies for the collection of environmental indicators (e.g. CO2 emissions, energy consumption, waste generation)
Mentor and train external contractors and internal team on environmental indicators and sustainability frameworks
Perform ad hoc team projects as needed

Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)
At least a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Sustainability, Finance, Economics, International Relations, Accounting, Environmental Studies or similar field of study
2+ years of experience in a related field (company fundamentals analysis, sustainability, data collection, data analysis, data research, consulting, auditing)
Basic knowledge of Python and/or SQL
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Excel, and BI tools (e.g. Quicksight, Tableau)
Prior/working knowledge of ESG research or analysis is an advantage
Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills, with clear attention to detail and ability to work with complex datasets
Highly motivated, independent, proactive and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact

*Only CVs in English will be taken into account

job description:
About the job
Our graduate programme has a strong record of laying early career foundations and developing well rounded Associate Consultants.

You will work on a diverse mix of international projects with the best-known brands in the industry, applying our deep domain expertise and methodology to solve complex business issues.

After completing our initial three-week comprehensive training programme, you will be providing strategic advice and high-quality analysis on all aspects of strategy planning, transaction support and regulation.

Because our project teams are small, you will regularly get direct exposure to our world-class TMT experts, not only in your office, but also across our global locations. You will receive hands-on mentoring from experienced members of the team, including our Partners.

Our culture is collaborative and team-oriented, and you will have an impact on project delivery from an early stage, which will provide a steep learning curve and a structured career progression.

Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:

conducting high-quality research
offering quantitative and qualitative analysis of that research
gathering and interpreting numerical data
modelling and forecasting using various pieces of software
presenting your main findings in written, graphical and oral form
contributing to proposal creation and client meetings
collaborating with other teams across our global locations
developing deep sector knowledge
and more
On top of an exciting new role and competitive salary, we offer many attractive benefits including:

An annual bonus
Flexible working
Home-working equipment fund
Your birthday off
Career coaching programmes
Health and wellbeing programmes
Continuous training for professional and personal development
Corporate Social Responsibility initiatives
Volunteering days
We are proud to be an equal-opportunities employer and ensure fair work practices for all our employees, clients, candidates or other associated persons.



Qualifications

If you are a problem-solver who is critical and analytical in your approach, then this is the right job for you.

You must have graduated by September 2023, or earlier. You have a degree from any academic background (including STEM, Humanities, and others), and you must enjoy working with numbers as we are a quantitative data-driven business.

As long as you are keen to learn about the sector, you don‚Äôt need to have a TMT background. As a matter of fact, many of our consultants only became TMT experts after joining us.

You must also be fluent in English and Spanish.



Additional Information

You can see the application deadline and the recruitment process timeframe on each local office‚Äôs career‚Äôs pages here.

job description:
About the job
A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.

Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, Proton Mail, is now the world‚Äôs largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, and Proton Drive, give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared.

Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times , some of the world‚Äôs largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 70 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world.

Join one of Europe‚Äôs fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world‚Äôs most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do

Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
Collaborate with the data science team in developing advanced analytics applications for the business unit
Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units

Job Requirements

Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
Strong analytical skills
Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
at least 3 years of relevant working experience in the field
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Good knowledge of a BI tool, preferably Tableau
Good knowledge of Python is a plus
Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas

Why should you join Proton?

Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and by supporting other organizations furthering the same goals as us. Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable.
Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit with people coming from all walks of life, including many of the world‚Äôs top academic institutions and organizations, such as MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH.
Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service - Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more.
Grow with us - We‚Äôre one of Europe‚Äôs fastest-growing startups, doubling in size every year. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields.
Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else‚Äôs problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.
Benefits ‚Äì these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events and team building activities.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation when the relevant candidate is employed by Proton.

Our Group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Together with our 101,500 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are committed to accelerating the transition to a carbon neutral economy through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally friendly solutions.

We are currently looking for a Business Digitalization Analyst for our headquarters in Madrid.

You‚Äôll take responsibility for the quality of the solutions, testing them and ensuring best practices are used throughout the development process - particularly regarding self- explanatory code, maintainability and scalability.

Functions

- Communication/presentation skills, team management, relationship management
- Ability to work effectively in a global organization across different geographies, under time.

ENGIE is the answer if...

If you want to be part of an international group, able to offer a wide variety of jobs in a dynamic and promising sector, we are waiting for you!

job description:
About the job
Who We Are:
AKDM is a leader in delivering digital growth strategies guided by data, analytics, and business intelligence. We work with a range of clients ‚Äî spanning niche players to industry leaders across e-commerce, financial services, travel, entertainment, and consumer packaged goods.

Inclusivity for our teams is a priority. From DEI training to volunteering, we are on a journey to connect our business goals with values by promoting a culture of equity and access. We are actively seeking candidates that bring diverse perspectives to our team and work with us to build better, more inclusive approaches to work and collaboration.

About the Role:
As a Web Analyst, designing and implementing tracking solutions doesn‚Äôt intimidate you. You thrive in this role when you‚Äôre able to track across a wide variety of platforms, collaborate with teams across disciplines, and help establish a data-driven culture of measurement. Your passion for figuring out better ways to track key user actions that directly impact ROI provides the basis for many crucial downstream processes; complex analysis, data products, and measurement of digital marketing performance.


Responsibilities:
Develop measurement best practices and technology requirements to generate high quality, easily-understood implementation guides for deployments of analytics implementations.
Partner with client engineering teams to audit analytics implementations, troubleshoot tracking issues, and define quality assurance tests to optimize reporting effectiveness.
Collaborate closely with AKDM‚Äôs digital marketing teams to enhance tracking capabilities and ensure that data is accurately tracked through all pipelines and reporting endpoints.
Serve as the resource for setting up new analytics implementations, defining how they are similar, and how they are radically different to internal and external teams.
Actively focus on the future-proofing, scalability, and ease of maintenance in all analytics implementations.
Maintain a repository of high quality technical deliverables, methodologies and business development documents.
Stay up to date with industry trends (such as iOS14 and server-side tagging) within the analytics space.

Competencies:
Undergraduate degree or any equivalent combination of education and experience.
1-2 years of analytics implementation with an understanding of the digital marketing or ad tech space (i.e. attribution models, feed based marketing, pixel based marketing).
Comprehensive knowledge of JavaScript and an understanding of popular libraries and frameworks to enhance analytics deployment.
Understanding of common data layer methodology, designing a cohesive data model (data layer) and interpreting a solution design document.
Extensive experience with analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, and Amplitude.
Extensive experience with marketing and advertising engines such as Facebook, Google (Ads, CM360, SA360), Bing, Tiktok, Pinterest, Snapchat, Twitter, Reddit, and Criteo.
Extensive experience with tag management systems such as Google Tag Manager, Tealium, or Dynamic Tag Management.
Familiarity with deploying and testing analytics tools in mobile apps for iOS and Android devices, especially using the Firebase SDK.
Proven critical thinking, analytical problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to bridge the gap between technology and business management.
Familiarity with web technologies and website infrastructure (data layers, HTTP protocol, DevTools, cookies, client/server interactions, asynchronous website, etc..).
Ready to be part of a tight-knit, growing team; ambitious, can work independently as well as collaboratively and possess interpersonal skills.

Nice to Haves:
Experience with front-end development, including customizing templates for popular content management platforms such as WordPress, Shopify, Magento, Drupal, and more.
Experience with one or more data visualization tools, including Tableau, PowerBI, or Data Studio.
You love to figure out ways to automate work processes and have some familiarity with SQL.
Experience working in a startup environment with exceptional multi-tasking and context-switching capabilities.

What We Provide For Spain Employees:

30 calendar days for PTO

Paid Parental Leave: We provide 16 weeks paid leave for primary caregivers
Mentorship Program: Mentees receive one-on-one support from the leadership team to receive practical advice and guidance in developing future career goals
Flexible work from home policy


What We Value:
At AKDM we believe diversity is essential to crafting digital strategies. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, ethnicity, citizenship, national origin of employees, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected status.

job description:
About the job
Clarity AI‚Äôs mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.

We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK, and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

We are currently looking for a Data Strategy Manager to support our team for a temporary period of about, 6 months.

The role provides an opportunity to contribute to the mission of Clarity while working in a multicultural, flexible, and fast-paced environment.

LOCATION
Madrid or remote

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Do the quarterly reporting to data vendors by using Salesforce
Support to legal on data rights: you will support our team on all the questions related to data rights, and you will be in close collaboration with our legal team to asses them in the best way
Ongoing conversations with Data Providers: you will play a key role in the discussions with our different data providers
Establishes and develops trusted partnerships and relationships
Understand the decision-making process, workflows, and business and information needs of business unit heads, service managers, and owners
Understands how in-depth analysis of voluminous datasets enables the discovery of new insight that improves decision-making processes and operational effectiveness
Collaborate with partners across lines of businesses and functions, navigating the organization and figuring out who is needed to get things done. You will use your influence skills to establish a strong sense of working together towards a shared vision and goals.
Engage business leaders/staff and technology leaders/staff in an end-to-end process to understand and communicate data management capabilities to support solutions
Apply problem-solving techniques to determine business impact and strategic option


Requirements:
Business or Engineering Degree
At least 3 years of experience at a similar position
Ability to read and understand contracts with Data Vendors
Understand how contracts affect the products
Propose solutions to the requests that allow to remain compliant and address the business need
Business oriented person, with deep attention to details
Strong communication skills, with proven negotiation skills


Benefits:
Our people are our main asset. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values:
Our team comprises professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools.
Clarity‚Äôs Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by an excellent leadership team coming from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences.
We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:
Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions.
Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences.
Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time.
Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best.
Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles).
Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. Thats why we created our own ERG groups.
Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).
To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.
By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.
We care about our employees and think they deserve the best.
ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That‚Äôs why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options.
Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget.
Additional benefits are available depending on your location.
We are a US company with a UK and Spanish subsidiary. We have offices in New York City, London and Madrid and have possibilities for remote working for many of our roles.

Clarity has received several awards:
World Economic Forum Pioneer
One of the most innovative projects in the US. Harvard Innovation Lab
Top startup with impact worldwide by IMPACT Growth 2017
Top 10 Fintech startup worldwide by BBVA Open Talent
Young Global Leader to Rebeca Minguela 2017

Privacy Policy
Responsibility: Clarity AI Inc. 160 Greentree Drive, Suite 101, City of Dover, County of Kent, Delaware 19904, United States.
Purpose: management of selection processes for new employees.
Legitimation: necessary processing for contract execution.

Rights: the interested party may exercise the rights of access, rectification, opposition, limitation, suppression, portability and not to be the object of automated decisions according to the Privacy Policy.

About the job
Menhir Financial is a company that applies Artificial Intelligence to optimize processes and improve results, mainly focused on the banking sector.

We are building the next generation of technology for the management of NPL (non-Performing Loan) portfolios by combining machine learning models that already manage more than 800 million euros in loans. We work with first-level financial institutions.

We are looking for a Data Scientist eager to participate in the entire process of an Artificial Intelligence project: data analysis, cleaning, preprocessing, model development, hyperparameter optimization, backtesting and deployment.

You will face challenges to be solved and will have a deep impact on the final product. You will work in an agile environment, with incredible engineers who believe in our mission. We are looking for a data enthusiast who enjoys learning and building.

Tasks

üöÄ The job:
You will develop and deploy new AI models, which will be used to analyze portfolios, predict behavior results, decipher the marketing mix and increase business opportunities for our clients

You will generate measurable impact in international companies
We make technical decisions as a team, listening to each other to come up with good ideas.
We know that talent attracts talent. We would love for you to help bring in the people you liked working with the most.

Requirements

üß† Requirements:
+1 year of experience as a Data Scientist
Degree in Computer Engineering, Telecommunications, Mathematics or any other engineering
Ability to analyze data in Python, obtain graphics and draw conclusions
Ability to develop AI models in Python, knowledge of frameworks and advanced algorithms
Knowledge of DB: SQL
Knowledge of Git for version control and teamwork
English

We value:
Experience in Cloud
Knowledge of CI / CD, construction and deployment tools (for example, Jenkins, Github Actions) and monitoring systems
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes or containers in general
Knowledge of DB: NoSQL
Being familiar with financial platforms and investment jargon (ROI stands for Return On Investment)
Having worked in fast-paced startup environments
Other languages

Benefits

üìä Benefits:
Competitive salary
Stock options
Flexible schedule: we care that you can reconcile your work life with your personal life
The work model is semi-presential, combining teleworking and presence
Health insurance fully covered by Menhir
Young environment

We are a team of data enthusiasts with a strong will to improve the established by means of AI. Do you want to be part of the Menhir ecosystem?

job description:
About the job
The Position

Mission

As a Business Analyst (BA) you will oversee and perform analytical and conceptual activities to one or many accounted business domain(s) against internal business partners.

What you‚Äôll be working on

Is an active part in the product‚Äôs lifecycle management and ensures that any solution is chosen to fulfill known and understood business requirements, fitting into the Product roadmap definitions and continuously providing business value over its lifecycle
Often assumes the additional role of IT Business Partner, Product Manager, Squad Lead where appropriate
Develops and maintains the business case including high level solution options and resource estimates and resource confirmation as in support to the strategic backlog management process
Acts as an interface between business and IT functions and as a contact point for business leads in order to launch initiatives, leading and driving the scoping phase
Collaborates with IT Business Partner and/or Product Manager in business development activities like translating business strategy in technology enabled strategies, C-POD activities, portfolio management processes, feasibility studies, clarifying available technology on the market and vendor selection (RFI/RFP/RFQ)
Strives for harmonization of business processes across sites and departments by propagating common standardized data models, applications and technologies that are in line with the cross-functional or functional Informatics strategies and architectures
Performs typical Business Analysis activities and creates deliverables as per Roche standards within a squad/project like a Business Case, Project Charter and URS/User Stories
Works with delivery and the project team to ensure that the final solution matches the URS and customer‚Äôs needs and is delivered according to plan

The ideal candidate
Has business domain knowledge for the following area(s) International market, international commercial, and affiliates environment
Has the typical skills expected from a Business Analyst, i.e.: business partnering, ability to quickly learn new business domains, requirements elicitation and management, business process analysis and design, usability and the ability to facilitate workshops
Has an Agile mindset in the approach to work, i.e.:
Enables a diverse group of partners to speak with a single voice
Ensures the right information is available to the development team in the right level of detail at the right time so that the product can be developed and matches customers needs
Exhibits intellectual curiosity and integrity and has a strong passion to bring value-adding technology to the business.
Exhibits strong soft skills typically required as a BA (i.e.: active listening, challenging the status quo

At Roche, we believe in diversity and inclusion as essential values for our success. We have special interest in integrating people with disabilities into our teams. If you have a disability, for us it is a plus, and we have special benefits for you: Go ahead and present your candidacy!

Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we‚Äôve become one of the world‚Äôs leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Social Benefits And Teleworking Under Our Company Policy.

job description:
About the job
To empower our Funnels Performance Team, we are looking for a talented Digital Analyst to help the company with all their digital strategies.

We are WIRIS, a software development company founded 20 years ago and headquartered in Barcelona with offices in the USA, and Long Beach (California) since we acquired Design Science company in 2017. Over the past few years, we‚Äôve been named ‚ÄúThe Makers of MathType‚Äù, and our mission is to make people's STEM work more meaningful by creating software with deep knowledge of advanced technology and science.

We are currently more than 80 people revolutionizing the educational field with innovative products that are continuously growing, enhancing our value proposition for our global customers such as NASA, Blackboard, Moodle, Yale University, and Pearson among others.

To find out more about our culture and values, you can take a look at our Instagram account: @lifeatwiris

Key responsibilities

Lead our digital measurement strategy and marketing funnel definition for all products to track their performance, user behavior and improve the conversion rate.
Be responsible for digital products tag implementations through Google Tag Manager.
Set Google Analytics 4 configuration in order to get the best insights from the collected data.
Work with other teams to make sure the digital strategy meets all the business requirements (product, paid ads, store‚Ä¶).
Track funnel KPIs using Google Analytics 4, Salesforce, and other visualization tools to support decision-making. You will have to turn company data into actionable business analysis and meaningful insights.
Analysis and evaluation of promotions, providing results and conclusions to main stakeholders.
Monitor that all tools are working properly and solve any incidents that may arise to ensure the maintenance of the measurement structure.
Participate in the definition and monitoring of digital business objectives, by acquiring a global vision of the company's challenges.
Identify, propose, and implement new measurement strategies or tools that can provide value to our current digital strategy.

Requirements

A data-driven mindset with a focus on real-time performance optimization.
1-2 years of experience in web analytics or product analytics.
Advanced knowledge of Google Analytics 3 or 4 and its implementation.
Advanced knowledge of Google Tag Manager configuration.
Experience in implementing a full digital measurement strategy, including session data, events, and enhanced e-commerce.
Understanding of the marketing funnel optimization and how online marketing works (KPIs, different channels‚Ä¶).
Fluent in Spanish and English.
Ability to organize and crunch data, interpret metrics and identify insights and trends.

We offer

Full-time permanent position.
Competitive salary + optional flex salary plan.
Flexible working hours and a hybrid work environment.
Private health insurance.
Birthday day off, in addition to your vacation days off
Unlimited access to Udemy Business.
In-house English and Spanish lessons to improve your knowledge.
A great work environment in Barcelona city center.
All the coffee you can drink, fresh fruit, and yogurt.

If you consider your profile matches our requirements, this is your moment! Apply now and join us in this new challenge!

Wiris is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We aim to create a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our employees, customers, and users. Our culture is the result of our behaviors, our personal commitment, our curiosity, how we collaborate, and the ways that we courageously share our perspectives and encourage others to do the same.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant from underrepresented minorities, persons with disabilities, sexual minority groups, and other candidates who may contribute to the diversification and enrichment of ideas and perspectives.

job description:
About the job
Location: Madrid alcobendas, Madrid, Spain

Job ID: 68814

We Elevate‚Ä¶ You

Join Schindler and help us elevate our world: Use your skills to allow megacities to grow. With our elevators and escalators, we keep the urban world moving.

Since 1874 Schindler has been a Citymaker with proud reputation for elevating not only buildings, but the well-being of everyone who lives and works in them. People, passion, and innovation are the pillars of our success.

Join us as a

Digital Analytics Specialist

We Elevate... Your Responsibilities

Schindler is looking for a Digital Analytics Specialist for its Global Reporting Solutions (GRS) team. As a BI Consultant, you will be building up strong Schindler business process knowledge to create impactful reports for our field management so that they can lead with data insights. You will be organizing your scrum team in close coordination with the product owner and scrum master. You will be gathering requirements and designing best-in-class Power BI reports in collaboration with experts from different parts of our business. You will be reporting to the CoE Digital Analytics Team Lead in Madrid and be part of the Global Reporting Solutions (GRS) of Schindler based in Ebikon, Switzerland.

We are looking for a people-minded technologist, who is passionate about analytics & reporting, comfortable with driving change, a solid problem-solver, with proven ability to operate and deliver in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, all the while meeting our high-quality standards. Candidates need a well-rounded background to balance the line between IT and the business.

You will mainly be responsible for the following tasks:
Design new impactful reports in co-creation for our management cockpit together with global business and lead users in design thinking sessions, considering data model and Power BI capabilities
Manage the backlog of your scrum team by breaking apart and prioritizing requirements so that your team can ship value every sprint
Lead your functional team, which constitutes of several developers and a data modeler by defining clear sprint goals and sprint backlogs
Demo your new or enhanced reports to gather user feedback so that we ensure usefulness and impact of our solutions
Test the functionality of your reports and collaborate with the quality assurance specialist in your team to match the expected results
Support the business change manager of our global team in the worldwide roll-out of your reports by enhancing the reports to match evolving user expectations

We Elevate... Your Best Self

Furthermore, you possess the following experience:
At least 2-3 years of experience in various BI projects with solid knowledge in one of the leading BI tools (e.g. Power BI, Qlik or Tableau) for data analytics, visualizations, reporting. Knowledge of Power BI is a plus.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration or engineering.
Full BI lifecycle experience (from requirement to report).
Strong problem solver and ability to translate business needs to impactful reports.
Evangelist for change management and driving digitalization within a multinational environment.
SAP knowledge (in one or more modules: FICO/MM, SD, Contracts) is a plus.
Proven success in contributing to a team-oriented environment.
Highly organized; able to structure and manage large quantities of complex information. Knowledge of Confluence and Jira software is a plus.
Fluency in English and proactive communication effectively with all levels of staff and management.

We Elevate... You
Flexible compensation plan

Childcare vouchers, car rental, health insurance with benefits for your family members, restauant vouchers... Save money with the flexible remuneration and its tax advantages!
Flexible hours

enter between 7:30 am and 9:30 am and leave between 05:00 pm and 07:00 pm. Is there a lot of traffic in the mornings after dropping the children off at school or are you an early riser to make the most of the day? Organize it the way you want with our flexible schedule!
Vacations

You will enjoy a continuous working day in the summer, and how many things can you do in almost a month? if you don't know, start thinking about it! here you have almost 1 month of annual vacation! Also, think about what you are going to do in the summer evenings because here you will have them free!
Online training in technology and languages

Do you want to get certified in your new favorite technology? Do you prefer to learn a new language? at Schindler you have online training for this, 100% subsidized by the company.

job description:
About the job
TUI Group is the world‚Äôs number one integrated tourism business. Accommodation Sourcing is a global team within TUI technology responsible for the connectivity and sourcing of hotel and accommodation portfolio. We are a multi-disciplinary team of experts across Architecture, Engineering, DevOps and Agile Delivery providing services across the UK, Ireland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Germany, Belgium and The Netherlands.

At TUI we‚Äôre ambitious to become the leader in technology within the travel industry and to achieve this we are looking to build a capable, creative team who want to be a part of accomplishing that goal.


We never stop looking ahead, seeking new ways to delight our customers and grow our business. We recognise the power of digital and the massive contribution this brings to creating a truly unique and differentiated customer experience.


The Business Analyst is a critical thinker with a keen eye for detail. Actively consulting with stakeholders, probing to create and communicate a common understanding of the problem that needs solving. Working within a fast-paced agile environment, the Business Analyst thinks outside of the box, loves collaborating across teams and is a lifelong learner.

The Business Analyst in the supplier connectivity environment is a primarily a technical role. A general technical understanding of data exchange via APIs is required as well as reading and working with technical data exchange formats. The specification and design of data models and the data flow between different micro services as well as the mapping of business-related data is one of the core tasks for the Business Analyst.

ABOUT THE JOB:

As a Business Analyst, you are part of a cross-functional team that delivers micro service driven backend solutions from conception to operation. You will collaborate with business analysts, software developers, architects, stakeholder, business partners and tech experts to clearly define, document and communicate requirements that will enable implementation of new changes and enhancements to our digital platforms in an agile manner.

You‚Äôre responsible for evaluating solution options, consulting with stakeholders as needed to define and articulate business needs in a way that enables the design and delivery of technical solutions that add value across TUI global platforms and services. You use your deep understanding of TUI products and systems, business models, processes, data flows and their link to business capabilities to plan and deliver high quality business analysis that supports the ongoing delivery of growth and digital transformation across our key markets.

Working alongside a varied set of technology and business stakeholders, you define and document new business, user, and system requirements, considering impacts to upstream/ downstream services. You manage the requirement lifecycle from planning through to elicitation, testing, delivery, and business acceptance. You can provide business analysis to multiple scrum-oriented delivery teams and work closely with the technology lead to prioritise and manage complex backlogs.

As a Business Analyst you distil the needs of business and using your strong collaboration skills you support your team to deliver the best solutions to our customers‚Äô needs. You are commercially astute, focusing on solving business problems in the best way.

You love to work in an international, multi-cultural team. You challenge constructively and have high expectations of yourself and others. You always drive for excellence, ownership and self-organisation at‚ÄØteam‚ÄØand personal level.‚ÄØ You love to learn and acquire new skills and keep up to date with latest developments in your focus areas. You‚Äôre an active member in the Business Analyst community.

Security is part of everyone‚Äôs job. At TUI, we practise secure behaviours first in everything we do.

ABOUT YOU:

Strong analytical skills and commercial acumen. Adept at understanding complex problems and communicating findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Collaborative approach, able to balance the needs of multiple stakeholders and facilitate agreement across multiple markets in a global structure
Proficient at using requirements elicitation methods including business process modelling (BPM), UML, test/use cases and prototyping
Experience creating, analysing and validating detailed functional specifications and elements of systems design; including data rules, data models, data flow processes, business rules, wireframes or other detailed deliverables that articulate how a business need should be satisfied
Good track record of successfully using requirements elicitation and communication techniques including workshop facilitation, documentation analysis, interviewing and brainstorming
Good Knowledge of technical data exchange formats like JSON, XML and YAML
Experience with technical API-technologies like REST and SOAP and corresponding tools like Postman
Knowledge of touristic data formats like EDF and OTA would be helpful
Familiar with database queries (SQL), micro service architecture and AWS services
Demonstrable experience of creating user stories, epics and acceptance criteria/scenarios within a scrum-oriented environment
A good understanding of agile and flexible software delivery methodology, tools and techniques and the software development lifecycle including knowledge of Scrum and Kanban
Customer centric, passionate about delivering great digital products and services
Passionate about continuous improvement
Open minded, inquisitive, life-long learner
Comfortable with ambiguity, highly autonomous

About Our Offer

Competitive salary
Pension scheme and life assurance
Generous holiday entitlement & holiday discounts
Forward thinking ways of working
TUI time off, purchase of additional holiday entitlement
Excellent rates with foreign exchange and discounts with retailers

We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA

If you require any further information regarding this opportunity, please email recruitment@tui.co.uk

job description:
About the job
Clarity AI‚Äôs mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.

We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK, and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

We are currently looking for a Data Strategy Manager to support our team for a temporary period of about, 6 months.

The role provides an opportunity to contribute to the mission of Clarity while working in a multicultural, flexible, and fast-paced environment.

LOCATION
Madrid or remote

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Do the quarterly reporting to data vendors by using Salesforce
Support to legal on data rights: you will support our team on all the questions related to data rights, and you will be in close collaboration with our legal team to asses them in the best way
Ongoing conversations with Data Providers: you will play a key role in the discussions with our different data providers
Establishes and develops trusted partnerships and relationships
Understand the decision-making process, workflows, and business and information needs of business unit heads, service managers, and owners
Understands how in-depth analysis of voluminous datasets enables the discovery of new insight that improves decision-making processes and operational effectiveness
Collaborate with partners across lines of businesses and functions, navigating the organization and figuring out who is needed to get things done. You will use your influence skills to establish a strong sense of working together towards a shared vision and goals.
Engage business leaders/staff and technology leaders/staff in an end-to-end process to understand and communicate data management capabilities to support solutions
Apply problem-solving techniques to determine business impact and strategic option


Requirements:
Business or Engineering Degree
At least 3 years of experience at a similar position
Ability to read and understand contracts with Data Vendors
Understand how contracts affect the products
Propose solutions to the requests that allow to remain compliant and address the business need
Business oriented person, with deep attention to details
Strong communication skills, with proven negotiation skills


Benefits:
Our people are our main asset. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values:
Our team comprises professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools.
Clarity‚Äôs Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by an excellent leadership team coming from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences.
We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:
Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions.
Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences.
Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time.
Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best.
Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles).
Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. Thats why we created our own ERG groups.
Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).
To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.
By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.
We care about our employees and think they deserve the best.
ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That‚Äôs why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options.
Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget.
Additional benefits are available depending on your location.
We are a US company with a UK and Spanish subsidiary. We have offices in New York City, London and Madrid and have possibilities for remote working for many of our roles.

Clarity has received several awards:
World Economic Forum Pioneer
One of the most innovative projects in the US. Harvard Innovation Lab
Top startup with impact worldwide by IMPACT Growth 2017
Top 10 Fintech startup worldwide by BBVA Open Talent
Young Global Leader to Rebeca Minguela 2017

Still reading? Awesome. Let me intro myself, hi my name is Remo. I‚Äôm the co-founder of ProvenExpert. You will be working closely with me; therefore, I want to give you context on us, what the role is about and what we‚Äôre looking for.

Me and my colleagues are fighting for the little (wo)man ‚Äì the small business owners and one-(wo)man-bands who grind each and every day to master their craft. They want to focus on delivering outstanding work and getting more clients ‚Äì not sales and marketing. That‚Äôs where we come in as ProvenExpert ‚Äì we provide a SaaS platform for small business owners to manage feedback and enable them to direct their online reputation.

Are you ready for a challenging and exciting career in the world of data? üåê Do you want to help shape the future of our reputation management platforms while working closely with our talented team? Then we are looking for exactly you! We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Engineer (m/f/d) to help us optimize our data infrastructure and develop innovative solutions for our customers. As a Data Engineer (m/f/d) at ProvenExpert, you will play a critical role in driving our data strategy and ensuring data quality and availability for our teams and customers. job description:
About the job
After 12 years in the gaming industry, Tangelo Games is today a leading publisher and developer of social and casual videogames on a mission to make people‚Äôs lives better worldwide by connecting them through playing. And, thanks to our wide-ranging portfolio, the fun never stops with free to play traditional and board games on our multiplayer gaming community 'Mundigames'.

But life at Tangelo is more than games! Since it was born in 2011, Tangelo has grown to be a solid company but has kept the agility, soul, and passion of a start-up while boosting a strong corporate culture based on community, commitment, challenge, and pragmatism. Always playing as A-team.

And that's where you come in. As our next Data Analyst, you will help our Analytics team to define and develop the company analytics roadmap. As a data-centric company, you will have the opportunity to dive deep into product performance and customer behavior analysis, leveraging insights to drive growth.

Responsibilities
Work with the Product Team on providing insights about user behaviour and product performance and help on the definition of features and set goals
Join in defining the key metrics required for analyzing product features, and collaborate on the implementation of data tracking necessary
Work with Marketing Team to analyze Acquisition and Retention campaigns performance and suggest improvements
Develop statistics models to better understand our business and help company growth
Collaborate with other team members on developing data processing flows

Requirements
At least 3 years of experience as B2C Data Analyst in the gaming industry
Holds a Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or Economics)
Experience working on Gaming or Mobile apps environment
Programming skills and advanced knowledge of Python ( R a plus )
Experience with SQL
Experience on exploratory data analysis
Experience developing analytic models
Experience on reporting and presenting results
Excellent level of both English and Spanish

Extra Bonus
Knowledge of AWS database technologies: Redshift, Athena, RDS, S3
Knowledge of Tableau
Knowledge of Airflow

Soft Skills
Analytic and problem-solving skills
Methodical and meticulous
Results-oriented
Hands-on attitude
Sense of initiative and entrepreneurship
Excellent communication skills in English and Spanish
Team Player

Perks
Flexible working hours
Remote work friendly
Multicultural, friendly and talented team. Play with the best!
Training Program Budget. Keep learning!
Employee Referral Program Bonus
Optional Ticket Restaurant or Health Insurance Plan
Flexible compensation plan
Paid leave on your birthday. Celebrate wherever you want!
Team-building events
Fully equipped HQ with beer tap, ping pong, boxing set and much more!
E-Scooter & Bike parking and shower facilities in the building

About the job
Great opportunity to boost your career in Finance!|International Company SSC in Barcelona

About Our Client

At the heart of PageGroup's business are the thousands of people's lives we change, the outstanding service we provide to our clients and candidates and the exciting opportunities within our offices all over the world. We're proud to set the standard in the recruitment profession - our specialist service with a personal touch is how we change lives for people through creating opportunity to reach potential.

PageGroup was established in the UK in 1976. We're now a FTSE 250 organization with operations in 36 countries, providing recruitment services and career opportunities at a local regional and global level.

In Barcelona, our Shared Services Centre regroups positions to support our operations in Europe and globally. Find out more here: https://www.pagepersonnel.es/clientprofile/pagegroup-shared-services-centre

Job Description

Being based in our Barcelona Shared Services Centre within the Order-to-Cash department, the role supports the creation and growth of a global team in charge of credit & litigation management. The position aims to provide support to the regional credit teams through data analysis, reporting & efficiency improvement. In the first few months the role will be dedicated to support the launch/stabilization of the activities and will evolve to data-driven/reporting activity.

Investigate inconsistencies, answer queries from the credit managers & resolve them in collaboration with the different teams

When needed produce Market & business risk report
Participate in Finance improvement projects through supporting the implementation of new processes, tools automation and best practices.

Administrative, data analyst degree or
Ideally prior experience in:
working in finance/O2C and shared service center environment
collaborating effectively with international team/cross-team to deliver

Knowledge in powerBi will be a plus

Dynamic, organized with a methodical
Proven ability to work independently and take
Continuous improvement mindset
Outstanding attention to details and accuracy; ability to identify data are correct, complete and consistent
Excellent communication
Fluency in English is a must
What's on Offer

Experience in a multinational environment (+40 nationalities in the SSC)
Competitive compensation and benefits package in Barcelona, various well-being activity options

As a BI Engineering Analyst, you will be responsible for providing insight and analysis into the performance of our delivery procedures and teams. You will combine your domain knowledge and experience of quantitative and statistical methods to ensure that our overall strategies become ‚Äòdata driven‚Äô and that Sr. Managers & Directors are able to consume the reports and insights needed to align to key performance indicators.

You will be part of a team responsible for driving insight into the effectiveness, quality and finance of software engineering projects, generating the insight to drive decision-making and informing development strategies. You will be required to support across many engineering teams covering several areas of analysis, such as delivery performance, team productivity, technology alignment, among other. You will be able to understand software development concepts and terminology and interpret the data to report to leadership.

What you'll do

Structure, analyse and report on performance from data extraction (SQL), to integration of new data sources and statistical analysis (Python) to visualization (Tableau or other visualization tool).
As part of the Business Intelligence team, develop and implement best practice methodologies for the quantitative analysis & visualization of data.
Work with Engineering to define and measure the key behaviours within services, identify key data points and how they relate to broader engineering strategies.
Define and measure business success, OKR accomplishment, quality metrics, standards and reporting.
Lead meeting with users and technical architects to gather requirements.
Design conceptual data model in order to depict new solutions along with logical data model.
Carry out analysis of the existing data sources and business processes to determine the construction and testing time of a data product to be deployed.
Perform hands-on analysis in support of business requests, including development of conclusions and recommendations.
Understand the business issues and data challenges of client's organization and industry.
Identify client organization's strengths and weaknesses and suggests areas of improvement.
Assist in enforcement of project deadlines and schedules.

What you'll bring

Degree educated or equivalent experience, preferably in STEM areas (Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or Operations Research).
Personable character and a good communicator ‚Äì ability to communicate complex, technical concepts to non-technical staff.
+ 3 year of experience in Business Intelligence, reporting & visualization tools (i.e. Tableau, PowerBI).
Proven insight domain knowledge (e.g.: customer 360 view, financial analysis, process effectiveness).
+2 years of experience working on SQL relational database knowledge and Excel skills.
Data manipulation, modelling and analysis skills.
This position requires limited International travel.

Nice to have:

Experience transforming data using Python.
Experience working with software engineering teams.
Experience working with PostgreSQL and API data integration projects.

What's in it for you

Inspiring and fulfilling work at an innovative and values-driven company creating cutting-edge tech.

Flexible working hours and ways of working.
Contemporary and accessible office environments with a range of workplace perks.

Being part of a team with a forward-looking, international mindset and agile working practices.
A friendly, inclusive and multicultural environment (we are made up of over 35 nationalities, speaking almost 30 languages).
Wellbeing programmes, learning and personal growth opportunities.
A range of employee events throughout the year, including team building activities, Learning Labs, Hackathons and Designathons.
Opportunities to shape the tech community within and outside of the company, through mentoring and knowledge-sharing.
