job description:
About the job
Clarity AI‚Äôs mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.

We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK, and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

We are currently looking for a Data Strategy Manager to support our team for a temporary period of about, 6 months.

The role provides an opportunity to contribute to the mission of Clarity while working in a multicultural, flexible, and fast-paced environment.

LOCATION
Madrid or remote

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Do the quarterly reporting to data vendors by using Salesforce
Support to legal on data rights: you will support our team on all the questions related to data rights, and you will be in close collaboration with our legal team to asses them in the best way
Ongoing conversations with Data Providers: you will play a key role in the discussions with our different data providers
Establishes and develops trusted partnerships and relationships
Understand the decision-making process, workflows, and business and information needs of business unit heads, service managers, and owners
Understands how in-depth analysis of voluminous datasets enables the discovery of new insight that improves decision-making processes and operational effectiveness
Collaborate with partners across lines of businesses and functions, navigating the organization and figuring out who is needed to get things done. You will use your influence skills to establish a strong sense of working together towards a shared vision and goals.
Engage business leaders/staff and technology leaders/staff in an end-to-end process to understand and communicate data management capabilities to support solutions
Apply problem-solving techniques to determine business impact and strategic option


Requirements:
Business or Engineering Degree
At least 3 years of experience at a similar position
Ability to read and understand contracts with Data Vendors
Understand how contracts affect the products
Propose solutions to the requests that allow to remain compliant and address the business need
Business oriented person, with deep attention to details
Strong communication skills, with proven negotiation skills


Benefits:
Our people are our main asset. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values:
Our team comprises professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools.
Clarity‚Äôs Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by an excellent leadership team coming from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences.
We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:
Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions.
Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences.
Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time.
Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best.
Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles).
Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. Thats why we created our own ERG groups.
Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).
To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.
By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.
We care about our employees and think they deserve the best.
ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That‚Äôs why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options.
Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget.
Additional benefits are available depending on your location.
We are a US company with a UK and Spanish subsidiary. We have offices in New York City, London and Madrid and have possibilities for remote working for many of our roles.

Clarity has received several awards:
World Economic Forum Pioneer
One of the most innovative projects in the US. Harvard Innovation Lab
Top startup with impact worldwide by IMPACT Growth 2017
Top 10 Fintech startup worldwide by BBVA Open Talent
Young Global Leader to Rebeca Minguela 2017

job description:
About the job
At Arcadis we focus on attracting, retaining and developing people who share our passion and commitment to improve quality of life. In return we offer you the opportunity to transform your world and the world around you, that could be through client work, upskilling yourself, championing equality and inclusion or getting involved in charity work, to name just a few. Our people value different perspectives, they care about the sustainability of our planet and dare to shape the future.

One of our core values is ‚Äòpeople first‚Äô, and supported by our Lovinklaan foundation, we invest in you for the long term, to ensure you reach your full potential. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to own your career and work on industry-defining projects, finding solutions to real challenges that make a difference to people‚Äôs lives. You‚Äôre encouraged to have a growth mindset and are given the space to develop personally and professionally, building a flexible career that works for you.

Role description:

Support in:

Analysis and monitoring of project financial and operational KPIs.

Assistance in the planning of project resources and costs.

Assistance during the execution phase and project control in the ERP.

Support for the implementation of The Arcadis Way procedures and tools.

Why Become an Arcadian?

Our work with clients has a direct impact on people‚Äôs lives and on the planet. We make moving, living and belonging in cities safer, more resilient and more sustainable. By partnering with our clients as responsible custodians of our earth's resources, we can create a sustainable planet.

We continue to think of new ways to make positive impacts and create better experiences for people; data driven and digital solutions have become part of the Arcadis DNA. Working together with clients and using techniques like design thinking, we can get to the heart of our clients‚Äô most pressing challenges and work together to solve them.

As a global business, we have committed to support five of the UN‚Äôs Sustainable Development Goals to ensure that our projects contribute to a better and more sustainable future for all. But it‚Äôs not just the work that we do on client projects that benefits communities and our planet. As a global business, we are committed to making a positive impact to society by supporting local communities where we operate.

To help protect our planet, we monitor and measure non-financial information to inform business decisions and reduce our own environmental impact as part of our commitment to be net zero carbon as a global company by 2030.

Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging

We want you to be able to bring your best self to work every day, which is why we take equality and inclusion seriously and hold ourselves to account for our actions. Our ambition is to be an employer of choice and provide a great place to work for all our people.

Transform Your World

Our offer

job description:
About the job
What we are looking for :

Detail-oriented process improvers. Critical thinkers who naturally see opportunities to develop and optimize work processes ‚Äì finding ways to simplify, standardize and automate.

Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, information, use cases, and industry analyses to develop best practices.

Analytical problem solvers. People who go beyond just fixing to identify root causes, evaluate optimal solutions, and recommend comprehensive upgrades to prevent future issues.

What You Will Do

Prepare and distribute timely and insightful financial analysis with actionable insights and provide recommendations for local business including divisional and enabling functions leadership.
Drive monthly P&L reviews with defined KPIs for all divisions within the region and provide analysis against budget and projection.
Actively interpret and review the results with the business, including trends/issues and opportunities to drive actionable responses.
Guide and support the business to take decisions on well supported financial grounds through business case analysis.
Prepare insightful and dynamic reporting (BI Analytics) for wide range of stakeholders to drive greater insight and visibility into divisional and Enabling Functions financial performance (utilization of Power BI as the main reporting and presentation tool). The regional reports include but are not limited to: sales and gross margin performance, market share and price/volume analysis by customer, expense analysis focusing on marketing and compensation drivers to provide insights for CTG initiatives, among others.
Provide financial analysis and recommendations to ensure business objectives are achieved as they relate to tender negotiations, pricing, or other commercial negotiations.
Actively support structured arrangements and cross divisional deals.
Provide analytical support to Commercial Business to gain a better understanding of market trends, customer trends, and sales channel performance
Perform necessary analysis that aids in the decision-making process and help improve business performance‚Äô
Review P&L and Balance Sheet information and identify errors or exceptions and provide information and insight to ensure correct journals and results. Determination of journal entry amounts for certain revenue and opex categories.
Flash commentary submission to Europe in collaboration with the Business Controller

Budgeting Cycle and Projections:

Plan, collect and consolidate input data for Budget and Projections with well documented assumptions for the P&L and Balance Sheet, including but not limited to: compensation marketing, discretionary, professional services, among others.
Responsible for communicating and reporting of Budget and Projections to the business and enabling functions, when needed.
Support in ensuring forecasting accuracy for the region.
Play an active role in improving Budget and Projection processes.

Other tasks/projects:

Actively participate in projects to further improve finance processes
Identify opportunities for cross divisional collaboration and Flex Finance solutions in the region and work actively with the business to provide the necessary analytical support to aid the deals.
Provide support and insights to the SPI working team and Shrinkage project
Support Assets and Compliance with Capital Placement assessment.
Other: ad hoc projects as assigned by Finance Business Leader and Divisional Finance Director.
Active involvement in business cases to aid decision making and help improve business performance, such as ROI analysis on deals, tender‚Äôs profitability analysis, flex finance options assessment, GPOs agreements or rebates negotiations.
Assist to secure the internal controls for local finance is aligned with corporate policies.
Strong cooperation with local AR team for accruals, rebates, and development of processes.
Support during internal and external audits.

Who You Are

You have a Master Degree in Business and Administration, Finance or other related areas
You have 5+ years of relevant working experience as an Analyst or Accountant preferably within a multinational sales organization
You are fluent in Spanish and English
You have a proven expertise in data analytics, ERP knowledge
You have practical experience of advanced use of excel, financial modelling and data analytics preferrable
Experienced in analyzing data, reporting and month end closing. Preferably within a large complex business.

About the job
We are offering a Jr Account & Ad Ops position to help us build the global contextual advertising leader.

WHO WE ARE
Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.
We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.

Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.

About the job
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Professional English

Glownership: Act as proud owners

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

About the job
As Business Analyst in the Pricing Analytics COE you will shape HP‚Äôs future of how we market and price our products. We are a very dynamic, highly skilled and diverse global team consisting of data scientists, economists, computer scientists, engineers, project managers, and product owners. About You
You are interested in customer and market behaviour and methods to measure and anticipate it.

You‚Äôre out to reimagine and reinvent what‚Äôs possible‚Äîin your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what‚Äôs next. We‚Äôre in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion ‚Äì it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you‚Äôre more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

job description:
About the job
We are seeking a highly motivated Content & Search Business Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for identifying cost-effective content options and developing optimal itinerary combinations in collaboration with our Content and Search product teams. Leveraging your expertise in data analysis, you will extract insights to evaluate current solutions and identify new opportunities for improvement. Additionally, you will monitor performance metrics and raise any issues or propose enhancements to optimize our overall performance

What will you do?

Define, lead, and coordinate quick corrective actions to address missed opportunities, and follow up with relevant stakeholders to ensure long-term sustainable solutions are in place.
Analyze, understand, and report on cache, content sources, and itinerary engine key performance indicators (KPIs) to provide actionable business recommendations that optimize performance, costs, and revenues.
Independently build meaningful and visually appealing self-service dashboards that enable stakeholders to quickly access and understand key data insights.
Develop business cases to calculate the return on investment (ROI) of engineering developments and partner contract negotiations.
Set up and automate data-related team processes to streamline workflows and improve efficiency.
Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders, including Product, Engineering, Data platform, Data modeling, and Business Development teams, to ensure alignment and achieve shared objectives.

What do we expect?

Strong data literacy skills and experience working with large datasets to solve complex problems, identify trends, and uncover root causes by understanding business and product dynamics.
Proficiency in data visualization and reporting tools such as Looker, Tableau, Qlik, etc.
Experience working with spreadsheets such as Excel or Google Sheets.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Prior experience in the travel industry and e-commerce is preferred.
Knowledge of SQL and/or Python is a plus.
Familiarity with Agile methodology is a plus.

We offer you

The opportunity to join our Phantom Stock scheme.
We give our employees the freedom to choose between the environment of work from home and our modern office located in the centric neighbourhood (Passeig de Gr√†cia) in Cloudworks coworking space where you can enjoy Kiwi.com ‚Äôs private office space, two common terraces with great views, common coworking activities (yoga, games, etc.), free refreshments and shower.

Hardware from Apple or Microsoft based on your preferences.
We offer unlimited contracts within a forward-thinking and ambitious company.
Relocation package (including visa transfer support).
Dogs and parties are welcome in our offices.
Interested? Join us and hack the traditional ways of travel!

Kiwi.com is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace and employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

position: Data Business Support Analyst - SCF Global Services
job description:
About the job
Country: Spain

What You Will Be Doing

Santander Consumer Finance GS is looking for a Data Business Support Analyst, based in our Boadilla del Monte office.

WHY YOU SHOULD CONSIDER THIS OPPORTUNITY

At Santander (www.santander.com) we are key players in the transformation of the financial sector. Do you want to join us?

Santander Consumer Finance focuses on business development related to consumer finance products, sales channels and commercial agreements with dealers, vehicle manufacturers or retail distribution establishments, as well as commercial functions associated with direct sales (branches, call centers or digital channels) and indirect sales (through third parties) of consumer finance products.

Santander is proud of being an organization where there are equal opportunities regardless of gender identity, culture, and disability. Our mission is to contribute to help more people and business prosper. We embrace a strong risk culture and all our professionals at all levels are expected to take a proactive and responsible approach toward risk management.

What You Will Be Doing

As a Business Support SR Analyst, you will part of the Digital Consumer Bank project, three hubs emerged within Santander Consumer Finance aiming of standardizing tasks, generating synergies, and allowing the sharing of best practices quickly and efficiently.

In addition to the hubs, more related to the structural and organizational aspect of the initiative, when referring to the business model of SCF group, given the intensification of SCF's competitive environment, the need to expand the product portfolio to meet the new demands of consumers, both in the automotive and the unsecured business, arises.

For these reasons, we seek to strengthen the analytical team of SCF collections (HQ) to support local units in all these global initiatives.

We need someone like you to help us in different fronts:
Management of centralized databases to support Collections activity across SCF footprint and products array.
Contribute to and support deployment of the Collections model commensurate to new business lines that SCF may explore.
Conduct necessary testing, including UATs, prior to implementing any improvement(s) to systems or processes.
Data cleansing and coordination of daily data exchange process with third parties including processing of CBU results (Financial & Operational).
Set up Reporting framework incl. ad hoc analysis for supporting BAU collections management and consolidation.
Back-office support and coordination among different CBUs (Collections Business Units) and local counterparts such us IT, Risk, Finance, among others.

Experience
5+ years of experience with Data Management and Data Mining Strong analytical and data skills Experience in retail / consumer banking business.

EDUCATION
Master's degree (M.Sc.) in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or similar.

Skills & Knowledge
High level of knowledge Excel, SAS, SQL. Any other programming language would be valuable.
Knowledge in Collections and IT related tools and banking applications is a plus.
Good spoken and written English, any other language would be valuable.

Other Information
Availability to travel.

If you want to know more about us, follow us on https://es.linkedin.com/company/banco-santander

job description:
About the job
HCLTech is an Indian-born global technology company helping companies reinvent their businesses for the digital age. HCL provides end-to-end services across industry verticals to leading companies, including 250 of the Fortune 500 and 650 of the Global 2000.

Our goal is to strengthen the brand in Spain. We are looking for an expert to work as Business Analyst!

Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled business analyst with a strong background in the finance sector, IT, Agile methodology and experience in robotic process automation (RPA) and business process management (BPM). The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving process improvements, implementing innovative solutions, and providing critical insights to support our strategic initiatives.

What you'll do:

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs, gather requirements, and develop operational solutions to address complex financial and IT challenges.
‚Ä¢ Analyse and optimize business processes through the application of RPA, BPM and any other IT solution ensuring efficiency, compliance and scalability.
‚Ä¢ Leverage Agile methodology to manage projects, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality solutions that align with business objectives.
‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain documentation, including process maps, user stories and functional specifications to ensure a clear understanding of requirements and solutions. Evaluate the success of implemented solutions, identifying areas for ongoing improvement and iteration.

Education level:

‚Ä¢University BSc. degree in finance, computer science, information systems or a related field

What do you need to know?

‚Ä¢ 3+ years of experience as a business analyst in the finance sector, with a focus on IT and process improvement.
‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of Agile methodology and project management best practices.
‚Ä¢ Exceptional analytical, problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders.

What do we value?

Intermediate English language level (B1)
Proven experience with RPA and BPM tools such as UiPath, Appian, Blue Prism, Pega or similar.

Important to note:

- If you have a valid disability certificate, Certificate of Disability in Force, please contact us.

Among HCL's principles we would like to highlight diversity and inclusion as a strength in our values and practices. To achieve all our objectives, it intends to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as a key factor and differentiator of fundamental innovation in our organization. We welcome and value all people, and we are committed to the inclusion and sense of belonging of each person who is part of HCL.
HCL is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

job description:
About the job
Job profile

As business analyst laboratory informatics you will work within the Corporate Application Services team (CAS). The CAS department is responsible for the proper functioning and continuous improvement of all corporate business applications within Synthon. The laboratory Informatics domain covers both R&D and QC processes and consists currently of multiple applications such as LIMS and ELN. As the Synthon organization continually develops and new processes are being introduced, we expect further growth in this Lab domain in the coming years.


Key responsibilities

As business analyst laboratory informatics, you proactively identify, assess and document business requirements, recommend business priorities and advise on options, potential risks and costs. You explore possible solutions, check whether any are already being used within the company, and if not, whether new solutions are feasible. Subsequently you analyze the impact of proposed solution across the business and develop use cases to explain/demonstrate business requirements/specifications to the various stakeholders. Furthermore, your tasks will include organizing workshops, providing test scenarios, training and supporting business process experts.
You will serve as liaison between the internal customer, the external supplier and the Information Services department to manage changes according to the applicable guidelines set for the pharmaceutical industry. The position requires occasional trips to our affiliates in Europe and Latin America. The QC department has developed a paperless lab strategy and as business analyst laboratory informatics you will play a crucial role in the realization of this strategy with the introduction of LES.

You will report tot the vice president Information Services.


Our offer

We offer our employees a working environment in which trust, pride and joy play an important role and as such, we have been acknowledged as a Top Employer¬Æ in 2020, 2021 and 2022. We understand our economic, social and environmental impact on the wider world. We care - for each other, for partners, for patients and for society at large. We support various educational initiatives and actively contribute to charitable causes and to the development of the communities worldwide to which we belong.

More specifically, we offer our employees:
A professional, yet pleasant and informal working environment with short communication lines, focus on cooperation and appreciation of initiatives
Competitive remuneration
Good working conditions with attention to ergonomic support
A keen eye on work/life balance, with the option to work partly from home.

Your profile

Your letter of motivation and CV should show that you have:
At least a bachelor‚Äôs degree in (Applied) Computer Science or Business Management
A minimum of 7 years of relevant work experience in business process reengineering and business modelling concepts, business systems development and analysis (experience in the pharmaceutical or related industry is strongly desired)
Proven in-depth knowledge of laboratory informatics systems like LIMS and ELN
Thorough knowledge of managing complex projects
Experience with computer system validation is a strong advantage
An excellent command of the English language (both speaking and writing)

Requirements

In interviews, you will be able to demonstrate that:
You can easily translate customer requirements into tangible results and have proven experience as a project manager.
You are able to quickly build and maintain relationships with your colleagues, our internal customers and external suppliers.
You have strong analytical, communication and problem-solving skills.
You are able to look at things from a process perspective.
You are also results-oriented, proactive and able to coordinate groups of stakeholders and activities independently.
Finally, you are flexible and still eager to learn.

position: CRT Data Management and Business Analyst Specialist
job description:
About the job
Job Scope/summary

EMEA Customer Relations Team (CRT) is safeguarding the HP brand by providing the right experience for every customer at the right cost through prevention, proactive care, and differentiation. CRT acts as thevoice of the Customertodrive improvementsacrossCS and to retain customer loyaltythrough pro-active customer engagementand by providing best-in-class complaints resolution.

Within this Organization, the SETI team has the responsibility to drive innovative improvement actions to prevent complaints from happening, to enhance the portfolio of solutions available to the agents to support our customers, and to design, deploy and control the processes used by the agents, and the metrics and reports used by the organization to manage the operation.

Job Specifics/responsibilities

The responsibilities will include one or more of the following:
Create accurate reports and visualization tools
Automation and industrialization of reports
Weekly/Monthly monitoring of operations
Weekly/Monthly/Quarterly reporting of performance to the different management layer (from direct manager to CS leadership team)
Be quality oriented and critically evaluate the output of data extractions
Continuously improve data organization, automation and accuracy
Help the team turn fragmented data into Operations Intelligence that will be used to support business decisions.
Organize/ integrate data so that it can be used to support consultancy and business analysis
Structure databases which enable both high level management reports and deep dive analysis
Partner with business teams to ensure data is complete, accurate & reflects reality
Make data available on agreed timeframe in a centralized way.
Provide meaningful analysis and propose strategic business improvements
Deep-dive into processes to achieve a complete end-to-end understanding and collect/provide meaningful data
Interact with CS business analysts to understand external environmental changes and potential impacts to the performance, and provide synthesis to operations as needed
Provide narratives on performance deviation and propose corrective action plans
Run Predictive Analytics to forecast complaint volume or other key CRT metric evolution
Model the investment/saving points to use the CRT budget to support our strategy
The candidate should be detail-oriented and quickly interpret incoming information.
Key Deliverables/accountabilities
Design, deploy and maintain the infrastructure that supports CRT reporting capabilities and CRT owned tools
Design, deploy and maintain the mechanisms/processes to gather the data required by CRT
Provide the necessary reports to manage CRT operations
Provide the framework to perform the periodical reviews within the CS organization (weekly/monthly/quarterly)
Provide the framework to report and forecast accurately CRT costs
Define key performance indicators and targets to run the business
Perform deep dive analysis on volume, costs, sNPS and turnaround time
Investigate, identify and understand correlation of CRT metrics with other CS/HP team metrics
Working Relationships

Partners, Suppliers, Customers

Excellent English, Ability to demonstrate verbal and written communication
Other European languages will be an advantage
Personal Skills And Qualities
Highly motivated in business understanding and ‚Äúplaying‚Äù with high volume of data
Ability to quickly and accurately organize data and transform it into visual tools and meaningful information
Detail Oriented with ability to explain the global picture
Ability to communicate across functional boundaries
Strong quality oriented, can-do attitude
Great team player, flexible, optimist!
Proactive & confident, can work largely unsupervised in a Virtual environment
Eagerness to learn and improve, good listener
Technical skills (procedures and documents the employee has to be acquainted with):
Strong expertise in SQL, ASP.NET, Power BI, Excel, VBA, IRS Reporting Studio
Skills in Data Management (Engineering) together with a strong motivation for business and financial analysis and understanding
Knowledge in RPA/Automation or in Phyton/R will be an advantage
Demonstrate knowledge of corporate organization and policies.
About HP

You‚Äôre out to reimagine and reinvent what‚Äôs possible‚Äîin your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what‚Äôs next. We‚Äôre in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion ‚Äì it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you‚Äôre more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

Solar Projects GmbH provides an extensive range of services, from greenfield development and turnkey construction to financing options and the operation of ground-mounted or floating solar parks and hybrid plants. Thanks to our global expertise, our local teams can cater to our customers‚Äô needs and requirements.

Due to our dynamic growth, we are expanding our Hybrid team in Munich, Berlin, Frankfurt, Freiburg, Madrid, Paris, Milan or in one of our many other European office locations, and are currently looking for a Business Analyst Hybrid & Energy Storage Systems (d|m|f).

What You Will Do

Modelling and evaluating business cases and their sensitivity analysis, to facilitate investment decisions and optimizing the revenue strategy
Undertaking feasibility studies on the respective energy markets and setting up revenue stacking calculation models for standalone BESS and hybrid projects (battery storage + Wind or PV)
Further developing our BayWa r.e. internal revenue models and assessment tools for Hybrid & Storage
Support the projects finance experts with insights enabling them to build up and modify financial models to fit BESS and Hybrid projects
Gathering market intelligence and monitor energy market trends that could have an impact on project valuation
Support Project Sales and PPA colleagues in negotiations with investors and route to market providers
Building the bridge between EMEA legal entities and the BESS & Hybrid expert team on corporate level as well as with the BayWa r.e. Energy Trading entity
Empowering our colleagues through workshops and trainings regarding revenue stacking modelling for BESS and hybrid projects

What You Bring

Academic degree preferably in an economic, technical, or mathematical discipline (other degrees are valued if experience matches the profile requirements)
Minimum 2-5 years working experience in the relevant business field (e.g., energy trading, PPA, energy consultancy)
Strong analytic mindset and high numerical literacy including Excel VBA and programming skills (e.g. Python, GAMS or Matlab)
Understanding of EMEA energy market designs and regulations (experience in AMER and APAC markets are a plus)
Broad understanding of BESS applications, business models and operational strategies including the valuation of them
Understanding of financial matters
Entrepreneurial and positive attitude with strong passion for the relevant business field
Experience in working with external advisors and international teams
Fluency in English (other languages esp. German, Spanish a/o French are a plus)

What We Are Ready To Offer You

Mobile working
Flexible working hours
International team (86 different nationalities working for BayWa r.e. across the globe)
Flat hierarchies, an open culture and plenty of leeway for your ideas
Modern office ambience (height-adjustable desks, additional monitors, ergonomic chairs, etc.)
Company restaurant (only in the Munich office)
Jobrad (subsidized company bike leasing)
Discounted shareholder program
Discounted fitness conditions
Discounted fueling
iPhone (also for private use)
*benefits may vary from country to country

Is This Role The Right Fit For You?

Diversity and Equal Opportunity

At BayWa r.e. we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates.

All employment is decided based on qualifications, potential, merit, and business need.

We do not discriminate on the basis of origin, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, pregnancy, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

We look forward to your application!

If you have any questions about the job offer, please get in contact with us.

Contact

Paul Schwind
HR Manager

job description:
About the job
We are the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group and we are currently undergoing a technological transformation and international expansion. In 2016 the re-launch of the Bank began and since then we have been in continuous expansion and growth, especially in our technological side. We work in a start-up format, using agile methodologies to take our clients' experience to the next level. In 2019 we launched the Bank in the Netherlands, Germany and Portugal and we have landed in Argentina, with others to follow.

Our culture makes us different; social and diversity clubs are part of our essence and allow us to live our culture every day. We are a flexible and fast adapting team that currently works remotely most of the time using all kinds of communication tools, we haven¬¥t noticed the change!

What are we looking for in this position?

Mission and responsibilities:

As a member of the Data Lake team, you will ensure the proper functioning of BigData processes of data management through monitoring tools. In addition, you will centralize the contact with different information providers in case of incident.
We want to take the digital experience of our customers to a new level and you will help us to innovate in the development of digital products in banking.:
We are looking for a person with experience in monitoring, operation and maintenance of Big Data processes typical of a Datalake.
- Daily data processing jobs built on Apache Spark.
- Daily monitoring of different data sources (> 1TB daily).
- Real-time monitoring of data flows through an operational dashboard.
- Anomaly detection and data re-entry.

Experience and Specific Knowledge:

Knowledge in data governance, as well as in AWS services: S3, EMR, CloudWatch, Lambda and Quicksigth will be an asset.
Knowledge in frameworks such as Apache Spark and programming languages such as Scala / Python, will also be positively valued.

What do we offer?

Immediate incorporation to a dynamic and agile company with a growth and expansion project.
Working in start-up mode with the support of Grupo Santander.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaboration in international projects and possibility of contact with different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events (now virtual).

Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!
Openbank is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered as equal without paying attention to gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age, political orientation, union membership nor disability status.
We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.
If you¬¥re not currently living in Madrid, Bilbao or Valencia and you are open to relocate, we would still love to consider your application.

job description:
About the job
SumUp is a digital ecosystem dedicated to local entrepreneurs. Our range of solutions answers all our merchants' challenges; from reservations, through click and collect, deliveries and digital payment, to the management of their business thanks to intuitive and comprehensive financial analytics.

In SumUp POS, we are creating the world‚Äôs most complete Point of Sale, for all merchants in all businesses. We take care of the details so that merchants can focus on what they do best. We help merchants better connect to their business, to their customers and to each other.

SumUp POS offers more than a cash register, it offers an innovative ecosystem where our POS Tribe of over 400 people in Paris, Milan, Barcelona, Germany and the UK are working hard to go as far as possible and become the European leader in our market.

What you‚Äôll do:

Build clear product KPIs and data models to help measure the effectiveness of our product strategies in achieving overall business goals
Empower our product lifecycle from ideation to launch with data-driven insights, quantitative analyses, actionable recommendations and other ad hoc support
Generate reports, dashboards, presentations etc. to nurture a data-driven community
Build and maintain a strong communication network with Product, Engineering, Data Platform & Commercial stakeholders

Previous experience:

5+ years of experience in a similar role working with Product & Engineering
Experience with Segment and Google Analytics (or similar product analytics tool)
Experience in designing and analyzing experiments (A/B tests)
Experience with Snowflake, BigQuery, or similar
Great visualisation skills, ideally with Tableau
Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple priorities and roadmapStrong SQL and data modelisation skills, with Dbt a big plus

Why you should join SumUp:

Have full autonomy (for real!) to propose, lead and implement changes that will up our game.
You will have the freedom to drive your career, own projects and make an impact across the company.
An amazing team and work environment that works with passion and purpose to achieve incredible results.
We get together regularly for breakfasts, team events, office parties and sports.

Additional Information üí´
Start date: as soon as possible
Full-time
Work office location(s) - Hybrid, based from Paris, Barcelona, London, Milan
Remote working: Yes - need to be based in country Location

Meet us! üí¨
Recruiter Interview - 30 Minutes
VP Product Exec Interview - 45 Minutes
Analytics Lead - 45 Minutes
Test - with restitution to the product analyst pool
Bar Raiser Interview - 45 Minutes

About SumUp

We believe in the everyday hero.

Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating tools that help them run their businesses. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first‚Äô attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America and the United States work together to ensure that the small business owners we partner with can be successful doing what they love.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don‚Äôt tick every box, it‚Äôs ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

job description:
About the job
We Believe in Better!

We are a global information technology company that builds high-performance, security-centric solutions that can help change the world. Enhancing people‚Äôs lives through secure, reliable advanced technology is our vision.

At Unisys, we believe in better! Here, you have the opportunity to learn new skills, apply your expertise, and solve complex problems with cutting edge technologies and solutions. You are part of a global diverse team that supports you, drives change, and delivers successful results consistently.

Our associates are at the forefront of everything we do, driving our clients‚Äô successes while giving back to communities and making this world a safer and more secure place to live and work. Our success is a direct result of the work of our people who live and breathe our Core Beliefs. Simply put, we believe in better lives. Join us!

Learn more about Unisys and our key solution offerings: Unisys, Stealth‚Ñ¢, CloudForte¬Æ, InteliServe‚Ñ¢

What success looks like in this role:

This role is subject to Unisys billing rates, productivity, utilization and total chargeability metrics. Only billable/direct client chargeable employees are to be placed in this role. Designs or modifies business processes and the corresponding information technology solutions. Performs analysis of business and user needs, documenting requirements, researching gaps and providing process and/or development solutions. Acts as liaison between the business users and IT. Makes recommendations to address specific business needs for information technology based solutions. Collaborates with multiple cross-functional areas externally and internally in the implementation of system and business processes. Defines system scope and objectives as well as the content of required documentation. Evaluates new software products to determine their applicability to current and future IT environments. Manages vendor relationships including issue notifications and follow-up until resolution. Evaluates new applications and identifies systems requirements. Evaluates new IT developments and evolving business requirements and recommends appropriate systems alternatives and/or enhancements to current systems. Prepares communications and makes presentations on system enhancements and/or alternatives. Developing professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues. Applies theories, concepts, principles, and methodologies to difficult but conventional assignments. Works independently within an established framework. Provides problem resolution that may be non-standard within defined practices and procedures. Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. Builds productive internal/external working relationships. Normally receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments. Has working knowledge and experience in own discipline. Continues to build knowledge of the organization, processes and customers. Performs a range of mainly straightforward assignments. Uses prescribed guidelines or policies to analyze and resolve problems. Receives a moderate level of guidance and direction.

Key Responsibilities
Participate in joint application design sessions to collect new business requirements.
Identify and develop use cases based on client requirements.
Verify requirements through analysis, test, demonstration and inspection.
Analyze business processes/systems, identify inefficiencies and required controls, document procedures, and track KPI‚Äôs.
Collaborate with internal and external users/customers to elicit business concerns and develop workable solutions.
Participate in planning initiatives, feasibility studies, cost/benefit analysis, and new systems design.
Work with the QA team to prepare test scenarios and data.
Document and manage business and functional requirements.
Review user stories and acceptance criteria.
Provide thought leadership in one of the functional areas, handle queries and competency building in respective functional area.
Provide functional solution and clarification on the inter-module dependencies.
Determine a project‚Äôs requirements by extracting them from business or government policies, as well as from current and future users, through interaction and research.
Anticipate future requirements to ensure successful outcomes.
Constrain requirements when necessary and focus on core business needs, rather than users‚Äô personal preferences, functions related to trends or outdated processes, or other non-essential modifications.
Organize requirements into related categories to effectively manage and communicate them.
Use powerful analysis and modeling tools to match strategic business objectives with practical technical solutions.
At regular intervals in the project life cycle, safeguard and protect the business and user‚Äôs needs by verifying functionality, accuracy and completeness of the requirements against the original documents. Safeguarding minimizes risk by ensuring requirements are being met before investing further in system development.
Emphasize simplicity and ease of use at all times, especially in implementation.
Identify and avoid extraneous activities that do not solve the problem or help reach the objective.
The business analyst is most knowledgeable about use cases; therefore, they continually verify the requirements and reject implementations that do not advance business objectives.
In application maintenance the focus is on preventing and correcting defects; enhancements, or making changes to increase the value provided by the system.

You will be successful in this role if you have:

Key Qualifications
Requires a Bachelor‚Äôs degree and a minimum of 2 years of related experience; or an advanced degree without experience, or equivalent work experience

job description:
About the job
What we are looking for :

Detail-oriented process improvers. Critical thinkers who naturally see opportunities to develop and optimize work processes ‚Äì finding ways to simplify, standardize and automate.

Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, information, use cases, and industry analyses to develop best practices.

Analytical problem solvers. People who go beyond just fixing to identify root causes, evaluate optimal solutions, and recommend comprehensive upgrades to prevent future issues.

What You Will Do

Prepare and distribute timely and insightful financial analysis with actionable insights and provide recommendations for local business including divisional and enabling functions leadership.
Drive monthly P&L reviews with defined KPIs for all divisions within the region and provide analysis against budget and projection.
Actively interpret and review the results with the business, including trends/issues and opportunities to drive actionable responses.
Guide and support the business to take decisions on well supported financial grounds through business case analysis.
Prepare insightful and dynamic reporting (BI Analytics) for wide range of stakeholders to drive greater insight and visibility into divisional and Enabling Functions financial performance (utilization of Power BI as the main reporting and presentation tool). The regional reports include but are not limited to: sales and gross margin performance, market share and price/volume analysis by customer, expense analysis focusing on marketing and compensation drivers to provide insights for CTG initiatives, among others.
Provide financial analysis and recommendations to ensure business objectives are achieved as they relate to tender negotiations, pricing, or other commercial negotiations.
Actively support structured arrangements and cross divisional deals.
Provide analytical support to Commercial Business to gain a better understanding of market trends, customer trends, and sales channel performance
Perform necessary analysis that aids in the decision-making process and help improve business performance‚Äô
Review P&L and Balance Sheet information and identify errors or exceptions and provide information and insight to ensure correct journals and results. Determination of journal entry amounts for certain revenue and opex categories.
Flash commentary submission to Europe in collaboration with the Business Controller

Budgeting Cycle and Projections:

Plan, collect and consolidate input data for Budget and Projections with well documented assumptions for the P&L and Balance Sheet, including but not limited to: compensation marketing, discretionary, professional services, among others.
Responsible for communicating and reporting of Budget and Projections to the business and enabling functions, when needed.
Support in ensuring forecasting accuracy for the region.
Play an active role in improving Budget and Projection processes.

Other tasks/projects:

Actively participate in projects to further improve finance processes
Identify opportunities for cross divisional collaboration and Flex Finance solutions in the region and work actively with the business to provide the necessary analytical support to aid the deals.
Provide support and insights to the SPI working team and Shrinkage project
Support Assets and Compliance with Capital Placement assessment.
Other: ad hoc projects as assigned by Finance Business Leader and Divisional Finance Director.
Active involvement in business cases to aid decision making and help improve business performance, such as ROI analysis on deals, tender‚Äôs profitability analysis, flex finance options assessment, GPOs agreements or rebates negotiations.
Assist to secure the internal controls for local finance is aligned with corporate policies.
Strong cooperation with local AR team for accruals, rebates, and development of processes.
Support during internal and external audits.

Who You Are

You have a Master Degree in Business and Administration, Finance or other related areas
You have 5+ years of relevant working experience as an Analyst or Accountant preferably within a multinational sales organization
You are fluent in Spanish and English
You have a proven expertise in data analytics, ERP knowledge
You have practical experience of advanced use of excel, financial modelling and data analytics preferrable
Experienced in analyzing data, reporting and month end closing. Preferably within a large complex business.
Process improvement experience (i.e. Lean/Six sigma experience) is an advantage
Demonstrable ability to drive projects that will significantly impact the business
Experience in Medical Device is a plus

Technical skills we are interested in :

Professional certification in controlling (RC/CIMA/CFA) or studying is a plus

Familiar with US GAAP and Sarbanes Oxley

Familiar with a bigger ERP system (such as Oracle or SAP)

Knowledge in Hyperion, Danube, PowerBI is a plus

Advanced Excel skills

What do we offer in return?

We grow talent; we give you the opportunity to develop your career based on your strengths. Stryker is a career destination for engaged, passionate and talented people who are driven to seek the innovation, growth and opportunity that only we offer.

Flat hierarchies and responsibility: through flat hierarchies, we strengthen the initiative and willingness of our employees to take over responsible tasks.
Team spirit & engagement: we create engaged and inclusive teams that encourage colleagues to share their diverse perspectives and opinions.
Recognition of your performance: at our company, outstanding individual and cross-functional team performance is rewarded. Ideas, projects, or other exceptional achievements can be submitted for various awards on a local and global level.
Competitive salary: with us, you will receive a competitive remuneration package, benefits as well as a pension plan.

job description:
About the job
Job Reference ID:

230001FB

Responsibilities

Societe Generale Securities Services (SGSS) has a Commercial team in Madrid, covering Spain and Portuguese markets. The commercial team consists of a Commercial Director and two Relationship Managers.

The objective of this team is to continue developing the sales activity focus on local players and maintaining an excellent service quality for our non-resident clients. As part of our sales strategy, our goal is provide global custody, cross-border solutions and specific products to extend our services, increase our client¬¥s data & market share, NBI and consolidate and our local presence in Spain

The VIE would have the following tasks:
Perform a detailed Product Market Analysis of the region/product
Review, analyse and document the Broker Dealer Market in the region
Review, analyse and document the Wealth Management & Alternative AM market in the region
Review, analyse and document the Insurance and Pension Fund market in the region
Review, complete and maintain the list of Tier 2 and Tier 3 Asset Management in the Region and their custody providers
Support a detailed Product Gap Analysis based in the Market insights acquired and the existing product capabilities within SGSS
For the Broker Dealer Segment and the Asset Management Segment
Support SGSS Global Sales Facilitation teams in contributing locally to transversal processes: Sales Plan, mid-year Review, Prospecting Universe definition, deals and meetings follow-up, etc.

Profile Required

PLEASE NOTE that since this program is primarily an international development program, candidates cannot apply to a VIE assignment in their own country of citizenship.

To facilitate the examination of your application by our English-speaking managers, we thank you for applying in English.

Graduate with a Master degree from Business/Engineering School or University with a specialization in Financial Markets
A previous experience in Securities servicing or business analyst in a financial environment (banking industry) could be appreciated
Analytical skills
Proficient in MS Office,
Fluent in Spanish, French and English

The VIE assignment in a nutshell

This VIE in Madrid is to begin as soon as possible but you need to plan 3 months between your application date and the beginning of your VIE assignment. It will last 12 months.

The VIE is a specific contract, under Business France‚Äôs eligibility criteria, opened to candidates under 28 and from the member states of the European Economic Space. For further information (including your financial indemnities), please see Mon VIE-VIA Business France.

We would like to draw your attention to the fact there that your VIE mission could potentially get postponed, depending on the evolution of the health crisis and subjects to the decision made by the Crisis and Support Centre of the Ministry of Europe and Foreign Affairs (MEAE). In addition, the selected candidate will only be paid upon confirmation from Business France and arrival in the country of assignment.

Why join us

As soon as you arrive, you will be integrated into our teams and will learn every day alongside our experts, who will support you in your tasks. Gradually, you will become more independent in your projects, making this experience a real career accelerator. You will also discover all the diversity of our businesses, in a sector that is constantly evolving and innovating.

At the end of your VIE, various opportunities could be offered to you, in France and abroad.

Business insight

At Societe Generale, we are convinced that people are drivers of change, and that the world of tomorrow will be shaped by all their initiatives, from the smallest to the most ambitious.

Whether you‚Äôre joining us for a period of months, years or your entire career, together we can have a positive impact on the future. Creating, daring, innovating and taking action are part of our DNA.

If you too want to be directly involved, grow in a stimulating and caring environment, feel useful on a daily basis and develop or strengthen your expertise, you will feel right at home with us!

Still hesitating?

You should know that our employees can dedicate several days per year to solidarity actions during their working hours, including sponsoring people struggling with their orientation or professional integration, participating in the financial education of young apprentices, and sharing their skills with charities. There are many ways to get involved.

We are an equal opportunities employer and we are proud to make diversity a strength for our company. Societe Generale is committed to recognizing and promoting all talents, regardless of their beliefs, age, disability, parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, membership of a political, religious, trade union or minority organisation, or any other characteristic that could be subject to discrimination.

job description:
About the job
Locaria blends insight, data, talent and technology to take global content further for ambitious brands.

We are a pioneering multilingual content activation agency which specializes in supporting marketing and e-commerce teams, media agencies and creative production houses. We are central to the global content solution of Stagwell, the challenger advertising network.

Home to the Association of Translation Companies' Innovator of the Year
Shortlisted for three business awards by The Drum
Named "Best Workplace for Training & Personal Development" by Adaptive
Every day we celebrate the power of amazing content to engage global audiences. At the heart of this is our diverse global team across ten offices, who believe in our vision that content is an indispensable, strategic service. At the heart of our collaborative culture are our values, which inform everything we do.

If you love great content, understand the importance of local language and culture, and want to be part of a dynamic team, then this is the place for you.

The Role

We are looking for Junior Data Scientist to join our team and assist in the development and implementation of data-driven solutions. The successful candidate will have a strong foundation in statistics and programming and be proficient in R and Python. Additionally, this person will have experience with SQL (specifically AWS Athena / Presto), GitHub (CI/CD), time series forecasting and statistical modelling.

The Junior Data Scientist will work alongside our Data Team to help develop, maintain and analyse our data infrastructure.

Key responsabilities

Develop and maintain statistical models for data analysis and forecasting
Collaborate with senior data scientists to implement data-driven solutions
Assist in the development of data infrastructure, including data processing, cleaning, and management
Perform ad-hoc data analysis and support business initiatives with data-driven insights
Develop and maintain data visualisations to communicate insights to stakeholders
Utilise GitHub for version control, Continuous Integration (CI), and Continuous Deployment (CD)
Collaborate with other teams to gather requirements and ensure data quality and accuracy
Conduct thorough statistical analysis and generate reports to support data-driven decision making
Continuously monitor, maintain, and improve existing data processes and models


Requirements

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science or equivalent practical experience
Strong proficiency in R and Python programming languages
Experience working with SQL and familiarity with AWS Athena / Presto
Knowledge of Digital Marketing
Client-facing experience showcasing data science projects
Experience with GitHub, specifically version control, Continuous Integration (CI), and Continuous Deployment (CD)
Strong foundation in statistics and statistical modelling, including time series forecasting
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Preferred skills

Experience with machine learning techniques and algorithms
Experience with data visualisation tools.
Knowledge of data governance and security best practices
Some degree of Familiarity with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure or GCP
Share our values

We take content further
We grow together
Celebrating Individuality
Doing good along the way
With care
D&I statement

Locaria is global by nature and vastly strengthened by multicultural, international and eclectic teams. Working together to achieve shared goals, our employees recognise the importance of our core value ‚Äòcelebrating individuality', and are supported by Locaria's breadth of cultural resources and insights that attract and retain the best talent.

We appreciate the unique perspectives and experiences that each person brings to our team and are fully committed to ensuring equal opportunities across the board, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability and gender identity. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let our team know.

Join our team and become part of a vibrant workplace and company culture that values and celebrates individuality!#



Benefits

In return for your enthusiasm and expertise, we can offer an exciting and multicultural place of work, competitive salary, wide range of benefits, and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organization.


Some of these benefits include:

Holiday: You will be entitled to 22 working days paid leave per year (pro-rata in first year), excluding public holidays.
Flexible Working: Opportunities to work from home up to 3 days a week through our Flexible Working Policy, and to work from anywhere as part of our Abroad Working Policy.
Refer a Friend Scheme: We're always on the lookout for talented people. If you refer a friend who is then hired, we will award you with a bonus of up to 2,000 Euros depending on the level of the role being recruited for.
Birthday Day Off: As a gift from us you will receive an extra day off for your birthday each year. If your birthday falls on a weekend, then you can take this the Friday before or Monday after.
Rest and recharge: The option to lengthen your standard 1 hour lunch break by 30 minutes, as long as you maintain the same number of hours you work a day.
Time off to volunteer: In line with our 'Doing Some Good Along The Way' value, all employees are entitled to up to 2 days off a year to get involved in charity initiatives.
Annual Wellbeing and Learning & Development Calendars: We promote a healthy working environment with a focus on growth, which is why we have a calendar with dedicated Wellbeing and Learning & Development sessions and initiatives throughout the year
Equipment: You will be equipped with a laptop, extra screen, mouse and keyboard.

Desired Skills and Experience
Analyst
Data scientist
Junior Data Scientist

job description:
About the job
Do you want to be part of a leading international company in offering solutions to the hospitality industry?

MAKRO (it is a subsidiary of the METRO Group), whose objective is to bring distribution within the HoReCa sector to its maximum level, taking advantage of the advantages offered by digitalization or the delivery service, always maintaining the focus on the client and success of your business.

We are looking for a BI Analyst for the new area of Data & Analytics, whose main mission is to be a part of driving force of business performance and business insights at Makro Spain that can lead to impactful decisions through the data :
-Work with BI and Pricing team to Harmonize / rationalize the company extensive data Pricing pipelines (ELT process) to maximize the data model and optimize the delivery of the reporting layer.
-Work together with Commercial (Pricing & Purchasing) in the definition and design of the Pricing 360¬∫ reporting.
-Design of KPIs and Dashboards to help the area in decision making (activation): index price, Gross Profit Margin, share of sales, Price elasticity of demand.
-Work with stakeholders including the Managers and business users to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data solution needs.

‚Ä¢ Being used to handling information for the construction of KPIs related to the domain of pricing such as: index price, Gross Profit Margin, share of sales, Market Price ‚Ä¶etc

‚Ä¢ Have experience in the creation of datamarts and work with large volumes of data for the generation of optimal reporting.

EXPERIENCE AND CAPABILITIES

‚Ä¢ Valuable knowledge in our Etl tool as Talend (valuable knowledge of cloud versions).

COMPETENCY

position: Business Analyst DAM (Digital Asset Management) & Analytics - Product Information & Content
job description:
About the job
Snapshot:

Nestl√© Global Tech Hub in Barcelona, Spain

Permanent Contract,

act. rate 100%

About IT (Information Technology) In Nestl√©

We are a diverse team of IT professionals in the biggest health, nutrition, and wellness company in the world. We innovate every day through forward-looking technologies to create opportunities for Nestl√©‚Äôs digital challenges with our consumers, customers, and employees. We collaborate with our business partners around the world to deliver standardized, integrated technology products and services to create tangible business value.

About PI (Product Information) & Content Products

Our products automate the production chain of Brand & Product-related Content. Digitalizes assets to increase re-use and adaptation via workflows. One source of the truth publication to outbound channels and platforms like eRetailers, Google MfC, Web CMS, EDGE, and eCommerce Shops.

Position summary:

Serves as a liaison between the IT MSE & Group Marketing, Business end Users. As part of the Product Team, brings deep understanding of the opportunities and issues facing your business function and advises on the best solutions.

Translates business strategies, opportunities, threats and needs into IT product requirements, then plays a key role within the product team to specify, test and deploy those as IT solutions.

As a Business Analyst specialized in Digital Asset Management (DAM), you will be responsible for analyzing, designing, and implementing solutions related to the management of digital assets and as well the relevant integrations with other parallel, up-stream and downstream systems. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including Group Marketing, IBS, IT MSE, Agencies & studios to understand their needs and define the best approach to managing digital assets efficiently and effectively.

Key Responsibilities
Serve as the subject matter expert on DAM, providing guidance and recommendations on the selection, implementation, and optimization of DAM systems and tools.
Work with stakeholders to understand business requirements and identify opportunities for DAM process improvement.
Analyse and document workflows, processes, and data related to DAM.
Develop functional requirements and specifications for DAM systems and tools.
Work with IT teams to implement and integrate DAM solutions with other systems and tools.
Collaborate with creative teams to ensure that digital assets are properly tagged, managed, and distributed.
Develop and implement training programs for end-users on DAM system.
Provide ongoing support and maintenance for DAM systems and tools.
Stay up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies related to DAM.
Work closely with stakeholders to gather, analyse, and document business requirements.
Define, design, and implement digital asset management tools and its relevant integrations.
Conduct gap analysis and recommend solutions for process improvement.
Develop functional specifications, use cases, and process flows to guide development efforts.
Collaborate with development teams to ensure solutions are implemented that meet business requirements.
Develop and deliver training to end users on new processes and systems.
Provide ongoing support and maintenance for digital asset management.
Conducts gap analysis of both existing and potential systems and solutions.
Ensure SLA‚Äôs and KPI‚Äôs are continually reviewed, and expectations are met.

Skills Required:
Strong analytical skills and the ability to analyse complex business processes and interdependencies
Deep understanding of DAM concepts, standards, and best practices
Understanding of business processes and ability to translate it into application requirements
Familiarity with marketing workflows and processes
Experience with project management tools such as Jira, Asana, or Trello
Sound knowledge on Product Development Lifecycle (PDLC) - Discovery methodologies, Design thinking and Design validation approach.
Familiarity with DAM systems, such as Sitecore, Aprimo, Opentext, Mediabeacon, adobe is a plus.
Familiarity with digital marketing tools, such as Adobe Creative Suite, Google Analytics, and social media platforms
Proficient in the use of the Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, PowerPoint, Mural, Visio

What will make you successful?
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in computer science, management information systems, or related field is an advantage
5+ years of relevant experience of business analysis in a relevant functional area: Marketing, Brand Management, Creative & Brand Identity Development, Asset lifecycle management, IP Rights, Taxonomy , eCommerce & Digital Marketing with a focus on DAM
Project management
UX/ UI Experience
Experience in application development that demonstrates thorough knowledge of the Product Development Life Cycle
Experience working in an Agile/DevOps environment using design thinking methodology Experience communicating with all levels, management, engineering, and end users.
Experience having worked in a global environment, collaboratively with cross-functional & virtual teams

Benefits

An attractive and dynamic international working environment with the most talented and engaged IT professionals in their field and working with best-in class technologies

Be yourself @Nestl√©, everyone else is taken! Our values are rooted in respect, we champion diversity and inclusion, and believe on the power of diversity to build winning teams where everyone can be the best version of themselves

Personal and professional growth through ongoing training and constant career opportunities reflecting our conviction that people are our most important asset

Great benefits including competitive salary and a comprehensive social benefits package

Hybrid working environment with flexible working scheme, allowing everyone to meet their needs enjoying the advantages of remote work and combining with the amazing Nestl√© facilities (dog friendly!) and culture.

We are Nestl√©, the largest food and beverage company. We are 308,000 employees strong driven by the purpose of enhancing the quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. Our values are rooted in respect: respect for ourselves, respect for others, respect for diversity and respect for our future. With more than CHF 91.4 billion sales in 2018, we have an expansive presence with 413 factories in more than 85 countries. We believe our people are our most important asset, so we'll offer you a dynamic inclusive international working environment with many opportunities across different businesses, functions and geographies, working with diverse teams and cultures. Want to learn more? Visit us at www.nestle.com.

job description:
About the job
At Tilting Point, we combine data, technology, talent and groundbreaking marketing to scale games to success. As the Senior Game Data Analyst, you will work closely with game teams to help inform decision-making regarding features of the game, balancing, player interactions, finding hidden opportunities and much more.

Your Future at Tilting Point
Analyze large, complex datasets to address ad-hoc and long-term operational and strategic business questions
