job description:
About the job
Junior Financial Analyst - Part time 20h/week

Moodle with us!

We're the world's most popular learning platform and we're on a mission to empower educators to improve our world.

Find out about your new workplace

Moodle is the world's most trusted online learning solution. The engine of our ecosystem is Moodle LMS, the secure and customisable open source learning management platform used by over 300 million learners worldwide. Developed in conjunction with our community, Moodle LMS is complemented by an ecosystem of products including Moodle Workplace and a network of partners and services providing hosting, customisations and support. We also teach and support educators to create effective online learning experiences and share open education resources. Collectively, we empower educators to improve our world.

We've built a passionate team of hard-working and driven people from all over the world, united by a shared belief in the ability of our platform to make a positive difference to our world. We respect our colleagues and value an open and innovative workplace, filled with integrity and of course a strong focus on education (yes, these are our company values!)

Find out more about us on our website.

What your new job can look like

With the pace of Moodle, no two days will ever be the same! You will work with and assist our Senior Financial Analyst with reporting and analysing financial and business performance, providing valuable insights and recommendations in a shareable, actionable and standardised framework, including:

Assist in the preparation of annual and semi annual budgets, and with monthly analysis of actual performance to budget.
Assist in the preparation of acquisition strategy models and in the integration of acquisitions, including standardising and establishing processes.
Prepare reports and slides with insights, recommendations and proposed actions.
Finance partnering with other teams and with management to drive better business outcomes. Compile high level reports, proposals and ad-hoc analysis as required
Compile high level reports, proposals and ad-hoc analysis as required by Senior Financial Analyst.


Requirements

We'd love to meet you

Especially if you can talk to us about your:

Business Administration / Economics Degree or equivalent experience
2+ years experience working in a similar role
Excellent analytical skills with strong Excel knowledge, being able to develop and maintain detailed excel based financial models and dealing with large data sets
Demonstrated ability to communicate with all stakeholders ensuring outcomes are understood and ability to work across teams
Strong business acumen and financial statement understanding. Accounting / financial statement preparation experience preferred
Experience preparing and structuring presentations
Fluency in English


Benefits

What's in it for you?

We've already talked about the importance we place on achieving our mission to empower educators to improve our world, our passion for our values and some of the cool things we are doing as a company.

So what about this?!

Bright and cheery office in Barcelona or work remotely.
Gaining new skills by working with highly skilled peers.
We don't believe in formal dress codes, bring your full self to work in your own style
The knowledge that you are helping millions to reach their goals
Plus, we'll provide you with a competitive salary
Does all this sound good? If yes...

Click on the following link to apply

Add your resume and anything else you'd like to add...

Press send.

Moodle is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. Moodle is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Moodle are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Moodle will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Moodle encourages applicants of all ages.

job description:
About the job
Clarity AI‚Äôs mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.

We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK, and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

Working as a Data and Technical Operations Engineer you will boost our data collection efforts, help us scale and build the most complete and reliable database of sustainability information.
The role provides an opportunity to contribute to the mission of Clarity by transforming and innovating processes and scaling data collection projects while working in a multicultural, flexible and fast-paced environment.

LOCATION
Madrid or remote

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborate with engineering teams and stakeholders to build key datasets and data pipelines using Python/ETL frameworks.
Working with the Business and Technology to deliver business initiatives on time by understanding the business need and responding with the necessary functional, systems and data requirements analysis.
Analysis, elicitation, presentation and validation of requirements to business and technology stakeholders to ensure all stakeholders have a common understanding of the requirements and the goals/objectives of what needs to be delivered to the business.
Understanding of working as an agile member and providing mentorship to other team members.
Performing analysis on existing platforms and databases/sources related to the initiative(s) to collaborate effectively with Architects and Technical Leads in-house and from 3rd parties, to collaborate on solution options to meet the business requirements.
Actively resolve/mitigate/escalate risks/issues/events which may affect strategic delivery and ensure the expectations by internal and external stakeholders are managed accordingly.
Support the configuration/integration of third party tools. Ability to do queries to APIs and clean and prepare the output for subsequent workflows.
Support for pilot testing on data retrieval using APIs or any other means for evaluation purposes or for capture as part of the collection efforts.

Requirements:
at least 2 years of experience in the data analytics and data engineering field.
Knowledge of version control, developer environments,
Advanced knowledge of SQL, Python and database concepts.
Ability to use the following tools: SnowFlake, AWS Services (ie. S3), Airflow and DBT
Familiarity with data warehouse development and best practices.
The versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job.
The ability to clearly communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to communicate effectively at all levels. Experience communicating to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross functional and diverse teams at all levels of the organization.
Strong organizational, time-management skills with the ability to succeed in a fast paced environment with changing requirements and priorities.
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability, impact and finance.
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English (Minimum C1 level-proficient user).


Benefits:
Our people are our main asset. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values:
Our team comprises professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools.
Clarity‚Äôs Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by an excellent leadership team coming from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences.
We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:
Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions.
Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences.
Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time.
Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best.
Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles).

Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. Thats why we created our own ERG groups.
Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).
To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.
By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.

We care about our employees and think they deserve the best.
ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That‚Äôs why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options.
Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget.
Additional benefits are available depending on your location.
We are a US company with a UK and Spanish subsidiary. We have offices in New York City, London and Madrid and have possibilities for remote working for many of our roles.

Clarity has received several awards:
World Economic Forum Pioneer
One of the most innovative projects in the US. Harvard Innovation Lab
Top startup with impact worldwide by IMPACT Growth 2017
Top 10 Fintech startup worldwide by BBVA Open Talent
Young Global Leader to Rebeca Minguela 2017
Privacy Policy

Legitimation: necessary processing for contract execution.

job description:
About the job
Beam Suntory is Crafting the Spirits that Stir the World. Rooted in two centuries of family heritage, Beam Suntory has evolved into the world's third largest leading premium spirits company ... where each employee is treated like family and trusted with legacy. With our greatest assets - our premium spirits and our people - we're driving growth through impactful marketing, innovation and an entrepreneurial spirit. Beam Suntory is a place where you can come Unleash your Spirit by making an impact each and every day.

Digital Analyst eCommerce

The following position is open in Madrid, Spain.

What makes this a great opportunity?

Beam Suntory recently entered an amazing race, sailing bravely through the exciting waves of the digital ocean. In typical Beam Suntory fashion, we just "go for it", Yatte Minahare! We're entrepreneurial, agile, dynamic and friendly, and love having fun on and off the job! The role is a fantastic opportunity to have a tangible impact, building the digital analytics capability within the regional eCommerce and Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) business unit (eMU). As well as gain experience in the exciting spirits industry and fast-paced Digital Commerce channel. All in all, a fantastic "learn, apply and deliver" opportunity for any ambitious self-starter.

Role Responsibilities

Develop the digital analytics capability within the eCommerce and D2C business unit (eMU), to support the delivery of 2023 targets and enable Beam Suntory‚Äôs growth ambition
Work closely with the D2C team to build full-funnel analytics capabilities. Set the benchmark for 360 digital analyses on marketing activations (owned, earned and paid channels), and identify new opportunities for growth through CLV and CAC optimization
Collaborate with core eMU functions, and Local Marketing, Media and Commercial teams to enable and optimize our funnels, programs, marketing channels, and campaigns through marketing analytics-informed insights
Be the ambassador of Growth Marketing within the organization, driving internal education, establishing the mindset (data and experimentation), and embedding the corresponding frameworks (process and funnel wise)
Lead Success & Knowledge sharing (learning platform), standardizing frameworks for measurement, best practices and how-to-guides across eSearch, eContent and eShopper, ensuring learnings are translated into relevant business recommendations
Support Annual Planning (1y) and Growth Planning (3y) process, regarding marketing spend and contribution based on analytics of prior performance
Own roadmap of pilots and new tools to test (learning platform) across the eMU marketing team
Collaborate and feedback eData and Global reports to help improve performance measurement and preserve data quality. Proactively input processes that can be improved with better analytics using existing data
Champion performance enhancement projects, such as brand investment (BI) effectiveness and attribution modelling
Guide IT team on systems/tools/martech needed to optimize marketing performance, track customer behavior, or enhance customer experience
Liaise with Global IT, Global Insights, Global Digital Commerce, Global Brand House Digital teams, and Local Markets to ensure the successful development and integration of the digital analytics capability in the organization

Qualifications & Experience

Qualifications and experience:
5+ years proven experience in similar role (digital analytics or growth marketing work)
Knowledge of digital marketing (and its metrics) across website and owned media as well as search (organic and paid), social, display, and programmatic platforms
Knowledge of web analytics (social and search, paid and organic), CRO, experiment design and full funnel marketing
Superior Analytical skills, data-driven mindset, and process oriented
Ability to structure business problems into data analytics plans, and analytics output into actionable insight and business strategies
Test & learn experience, piloting projects and sharing best practices
Think big and have a growth mindset and love to turn data into insight
Learning agility, curiosity and always up to date (trends, tools, techniques, etc)
Ability to operate simultaneously and effectively in both tactical and strategic modes
Professional proficiency in English
Capable of building effective and collaborative work relationships
Excellent communicator, can explain complex problems simply
Able to manage multiple projects, highly organized and detail-oriented
Willingness to lead, own and roll up sleeves to get things done
Self-starter with an ability to deal with ambiguity in a new role
Software requirements:
Google Analytics certification (GA4 preferred)
Knowledge Semrush, Similar Web, and Supermetrics
Data visualization/reporting tools such as PowerBi, Google Data Studio
Experience working with a CDP and email marketing tool (SFMC)


Preferred Qualifications:

(Traditional) Marketing background would be an asset
P&L understanding and (traditional) business KPIs (market share)
Experience working in a start-up where you had to define best practices
Experience in marketing research and statistical analysis
Experience in the alcoholic beverages industry a plus
Software engineering, automation, machine learning knowledge valuable

At Beam Suntory, people are our number one priority, and we believe our people grow together in diverse and inclusive environments where their unique insights, experiences and backgrounds are valued and respected. Beam Suntory is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, military veteran status and all other characteristics, attributes or choices protected by law. All recruitment and hiring decisions are based on an applicant‚Äôs skills and experience.

Do you have data engineering experience, and are you seeking a new job in Madrid? The APEX Group is recruiting a Data Engineer, and the role comes with an attractive an excellent salary and benefits package.

job description:
About the job
Atradius

The Atradius Group provides trade credit insurance, surety and collections services worldwide, and has a presence through 160 offices in 52 countries. The products offered by Atradius protect companies around the world against the default risks associated with selling goods and services on credit.

At Atradius, we believe in personal development and the Growth Mindset. Our Culture is based on teamwork, reliable accountability, constantly improving and unrivalled service. Read on more on our Career site: https://careers.atradius.com/en/careers.

Overview:

Atradius is implementing an all-new end-to-end cloud data platform and adopting a Dev/DataOps working culture.

The Data Engineer will report to the Lead Data Engineer and will work in a cloud-based Lakehouse environment. The main assignment of the role is to automate ELT and testing processes via code generation tools and custom code, to produce a robust and efficient set of certified data pipelines to support the business.

About You

Passionate about the power of data to drive better, faster decisions
A self-motivated learner
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, able to work effectively with stakeholders, internal customers and technical colleagues
Willing to challenge existing models and practices
With a solid background in Data Engineering, you are the hands-on expert with a track of record in working with Databricks and the Azure Data stack.
You are passionate about automation and are an expert when it comes to leveraging IaaS, CI/CD pipelines and Git Branching Strategies applied to the Data Engineering space.
You have experience in applying Data Engineering in credit insurance risk underwriting, collections, marketing and can create and support new business cases at scale.
You have a Platform as a Service mind-set and are constantly working with your clients to ensure their success in delivering value using the Data Platform components.

Key Responsibilities

Build and maintain a robust and efficient set of data pipelines to bring various raw data sources (internal and external) into our cloud-based storage and processing platform
Develop and run appropriate routines, including automation, to deliver a robust and scalable service with data quality at the core
Work with other Data Engineers and ensure we follow best practices and develop your skills in the agreed direction
Work with Platform Engineering, the Solutions and Data Architects to adopt best practice methodologies and maintain a data lake archive and appropriate transformed layers to support business needs
Work with Platform Engineering to deliver new/custom Data Platform capabilities supported by MVPs with concrete value add to the data consumption lifecycle, as needed
Support data governance and ensure data structures are aligned to policies and captured in the data catalogue

Enabling data science and analytics at scale:

Partner closely with data science and analytics teams within Data & Innovation and across the broader Atradius enterprise, understanding and developing solutions for their needs
Ensure the data platform provides the functionality for a suitable Lab environment, developing over time as enterprise capabilities evolve
Maintain a ‚ÄúLab to Factory‚Äù process that takes data science team models into production, then constantly evaluate and retrain these models
Prepare, maintain and make available datasets for prescriptive and predictive modelling

Qualifications

Related work experience:

2+ years building cloud-based data engineering/data science solutions
Extensive technical experience of building various methods of data processing and data models using a variety of database and infrastructure types
Experience building data structures to support first and third-party analysis under GDPR guidelines
Experience working in a similar environment/sector (Financial Services) would be helpful

Essential Skills and Abilities:

Fluent spoken and written English;
Is both a strong self-starter as well as team player;
Must be able to work under pressure when necessary;
Self-motivated and proactive in the working environment;
Proven ability to work with speed and accuracy to deadlines is essential;
Has an ability to rapidly absorb new technical skills and learn new concepts quickly;
Has a systematic, disciplined, and analytical approach to problem solving;
Embraces diversity and proactively manages data issues;
Ability to influence peers, team, and business stakeholders;
The ability to build relationships and convey authority when needed at all levels to resolve conflicts and maintain direction;
Takes responsibility and feels accountable for own and team.

Technical skills:

Very strong SQL and Python/PySpark‚ÄØskills
Capable of working with data architects to design and build complex data environments;
Expert knowledge of data modelling and different data structures and their benefits and limitations under particular use cases. Data Vault 2.0 experience highly appreciated.
Strong Apache Airflow dag development skills.
Experience with template based code generation frameworks.
Source Repository Management (GitHub)
CI/CD Frameworks Management and Implementation (Azure DevOps)

What do we offer?

A dynamic, international and challenging work environment
Training and support to reach your full potential including the opportunity for continuous professional development
Attractive terms and conditions, including competitive salary, pension package and a range of flexible benefits and rewards
Challenging tasks with individual development and training opportunities

Equal opportunities for all

The success of our organisation stands with the quality of our people and the ideas they have. Insights and innovative solutions for our customers are the result of an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. That is why diversity is extremely important to Atradius. To ensure that all colleagues within Atradius can develop their qualities, we promote an inclusive culture in which everyone feels involved and valued. We encourage and welcome everyone to apply to our positions.

I am Atradius! - Do you want to know who we are?

Get to know Atradius colleagues in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NnsgT04OpTU&t=4s

Atradius is a global provider of credit insurance, bond and surety, collections and information services, with a strategic presence in over 50 countries. The products offered by Atradius protect companies around the world against the default risks associated with selling goods and services on credit. Atradius is a member of Grupo Catalana Occidente (GCO.MC), one of the largest insurers in Spain and one of the largest credit insurers in the world.

You can find further information on our website: https://group.atradius.com

job description:
About the job
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in engineering, science or another technical related field preferred; Advanced degree is advantageous
3+ years of experience in a consulting firm, a technology company or recently finished PhD
Demonstrated leadership within or outside a work setting
Passion for improving businesses through technology and digitalisation
Exceptional problem-solving ability with the ability to use logical reasoning and creative thinking
Comfort with numbers, and the ability to untangle complex issues
Strong strategic management perspective
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Fluent in both Spanish (Madrid) or Portuguese (Lisbon) and English
Willingness to travel and work internationally

What You'll Do

You'll work in teams of typically 3 - 5 consultants to identify, and oftentimes implement, potential solutions for a specific client problem or challenge. Together, you will help clients make lasting improvements to their performance and realize their most important goals.

Over the course of each project, you will gather and analyze information, formulate and test hypotheses, and develop and communicate recommendations. You'll also present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members. In some cases, you will be asked to travel to your client site.

When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world. As an associate, you will receive training and coaching on how to better
Structure ambiguous problems and take action to solve them
Synthesize clear takeaways from complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative methods
Work effectively with diverse teams to come up with the best solution and move people and organizations to act
Establish trust-based relationships with clients to better serve their organizations
Communicate effectively with all audiences, including senior leaders, in a structured manner
Develop your leadership style, leveraging your own passions, strengths, and personal values
Develop your functional expertise in digitalisation and technology strategy
McKinsey believes in strengths-based development and coaching, and you‚Äôll receive frequent mentoring from colleagues. This will include a senior colleague from your office or practice who will help you grow and achieve your career goals. Additionally, you will have a professional development manager who manages staffing to help you choose projects based on your priorities as well as the needs of client service teams.

Who You'll Work With

You‚Äôll be part of McKinsey Digital practice and will be based in Madrid or Lisbon. McKinsey Digital brings together the best of McKinsey‚Äôs digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses.

As part of this group, you‚Äôll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and digital strategy to agile, cloud and digital business building. You‚Äôll typically work on projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm.

You‚Äôll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses, both on technology and non-technology topics. Our office culture is casual, fun and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. We have the freedom to try new ideas, experiment and are expected to be constantly learning and growing. There is also a strong emphasis on mentoring others in the group, enabling them to grow and learn.

job description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:

Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, Tripadvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders

What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study
0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company
Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g. SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence
Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently

It‚Äôs Great if you Have:

Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce
Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
Strong presentation and negotiation skills

About the job
Job description:

BME is the infrastructure of all the securities markets and financial systems in Spain and is owned by SIX.
REGIS-TR is the largest European trade repository (TR) for EMIR, and offers services covering SFTR and FinfraG. On this position, you will work closely with various internal and external stakeholders, in a motivated and dynamic environment in which we are responsible for offering as a TR reporting services covering all the major European reporting obligations.
We offer a career within REGIS-TR, will provide you with the opportunity to help the organization to develop strategies that transform its technology capabilities and solve the most critical challenges.

As a Regulatory Data Analyst you will be responsible for ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements by analysing and interpreting data. The successful candidate will possess a strong background in data analysis, with experience in a regulatory compliance environment.





What You Will Do
analyse and interpret data to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements
develop and implement data collection and analysis procedures
design processes and dataflows
identify and communicate areas of non-compliance
collaborate with other departments to develop solutions to compliance issues
stay up-to-date on regulatory changes and update procedures accordingly
What You Bring
bachelor and/or master‚Äôs degree in a related field, such as Data Science, Statistics, Business Administration or any Regulatory Compliance studies
a minimum of 2 years of experience in data analysis. Some experience in a regulatory compliance environment will be highly valued too
strong analytical skills with experience in statistical analysis. Technical knowledge of Excel, Databases, Access, SQL and Macros, will be a plus
excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams
knowledge of regulatory requirements and industry standards. Knowledge of Securities, Foreign Exchange, Money Markets and Derivatives will be highly valued
advanced level of English written and spoken to work in an international environment

job description:
About the job
JR0114149

Application Support Analyst ‚Äì Madrid, Spain

Do you thrive on working in an environment where the customer is your top priority? Are you a tenacious problem solver and tech savvy? Are you interested in joining a brand-new team, and a business that‚Äôs on the move? If so, then it‚Äôs time to join Western Unions‚Äô new Digital Banking Hub.

Western Union powers your pursuit.

Role Responsibilities

Our overall objective when serving customers is to provide excellent service with empathy, quality, and speed. Some of the issues our customers encounter require more specialized expertise to deliver on these 3 attributes. The main purpose of this role is to be the voice and face of Western Union for specialized issues our customers face related to technology. Reporting to the Customer Care Supervisor we‚Äôll look to you to:
Serve as a rapid response technology professional who quickly diagnoses and resolves technology-related matters that customers encounter during onboarding and their ongoing usage of our digital banking product. It requires targeted problem solving to diagnose issues and see patterns across customers. This will cover a broad range of activities, including:
Triaging the issue and being able to identify in which system/part of the product the issue may be occurring;
Estimating amount of time needed so that customers have their expectations set accordingly;
Performing basic development work and testing the solution before going back to the customer;
Coordinating across teams for more complex issues.
Possess sufficiently broad technology expertise to know when decisions can be made in real-time versus which decisions require escalations through established governance procedures. It is not necessary to be a subject matter expert (though that is a plus) but rather to have breadth across many topics and be able to go in-depth when needed.
Maintain a comprehensive and prioritized view of what product and process enhancements are needed to exceed customer expectations and provide them with an excellent experience.
Develop (and evolve) procedures and playbooks for how the most common customers‚Äô challenges related to technology are solved.
Provide expert input to Tier 1 Customer Service Representatives so they can be as specific and prescriptive as possible when reaching out to customers. This will be an important balance of customer-friendly communications with topic-specific information to help customers understand how their problem is solved.
Handling inbound calls and messages.
Role Requirements
A minimum of 3 years experience in one of the IT Service Desk teams, although candidates with other relevant experience will be considered too.
Experience engaging with customers. Preference for experience in start-up or financial industry.
Strong English language skills are mandatory.
Strong verbal, written, and listening skills.
Ability to multi-task and work independently.
You are a team player with the ability to prioritize workload in line with tight deadlines and under pressure.
Analytical skills and attention to detail.
Flexibility to work shifts or on Saturdays according to business needs.
We make financial services accessible to humans everywhere. Join us for what‚Äôs next.

Western Union is positioned to become the world‚Äôs most accessible financial services company ‚Äîtransforming lives and communities. To support this, we have launched a Digital Banking Service and Wallet across several European markets to enhance our customers‚Äô experiences by offering a state-of-the-art digital Ecosystem. More than moving money, we design easy-to-use products and services for our digital and physical financial ecosystem that help our customers move forward.

Just as we help our global customers prosper, we support our employees in achieving their professional aspirations. You‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and build a career, as well as receive a great compensation package. If you‚Äôre ready to help drive the future of financial services, it‚Äôs time for Western Union. Learn more about our purpose and people at https://careers.westernunion.com/

Benefits

You will also have access to short-term incentives, multiple health insurance options, accident and life insurance, and access to best-in-class development platforms, to name a few

(https://careers.westernunion.com/global-benefits/). Please see the location-specific benefits below and note that your Recruiter may share additional role-specific benefits during your interview process or in an offer of employment.

Your Spain Specific Benefits Include
25 days annual leave ‚Äì plus 14 public holidays
Comprehensive life & medical cover ‚Äì including dependents.
Contributory pension plan
Preventative Care Assistance program
We are passionate about diversity. Our commitment is to provide an inclusive culture that celebrates the unique backgrounds and perspectives of our global teams while reflecting the communities we serve. We do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, religion, political affiliation, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, or veteran status. The company will provide accommodation to applicants, including those with disabilities, during the recruitment process, following applicable laws.

About the job
The Position

The ASPIRE Roadmap (ASPIRE Program) is a multi-year program which aims at defining and developing the functional ERP roadmaps in order to simplify, standardize and automate business processes and systems leveraging SAP‚Äôs, industry and available Roche best practices.

As the ASPIRE Global IT Master Data Business Solution Analyst, you are responsible for driving alignment of the global Master Data template requirements for the program.

Your primary responsibilities include:

Experience in implementing and working with SAP MDG-F and other MDG modules

At Roche, we believe in diversity and inclusion as essential values for our success. We have special interest in integrating people with disabilities into our teams. If you have a disability, for us it is a plus, and we have special benefits for you: Go ahead and present your candidacy!

Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we‚Äôve become one of the world‚Äôs leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

job description:
About the job
Business Function Overview

In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day and we need you as a Data Center Critical Environment Technician.

Microsoft‚Äôs Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I Critical Environment Technician, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform. As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development of all employees and offers trainings and opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion trainings and events, and professional certifications.

Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 100 datacenters and 1 million servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.

With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our datacenter design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider.

Do you want to empower billions across the world? Come and join us in CO+I and be at the forefront of the action!

Responsibilities

Responsibilities

As a successful Critical Environment Technician, your success is measured by:

Equipment and Systems Operations
Serve as an operations specialist in one major area of CE operations (e.g., electrical, mechanical, controls, generators) and works on advanced tasks independently.
Inspect and supervise critical environment-related facility equipment (e.g., controls, heating, ventilation, and air conditioning [HVAC], mechanical systems), building, and grounds regularly for unsafe or abnormal conditions and escalate per applicable policies and standards.
Utilize telemetry, control systems, and other platforms, to monitor performance of maintenance and operations of equipment (e.g., electrical, mechanical, fire/life safety) within the data center.
Utilize internal computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) to track all equipment assets and to complete work order requests for maintenance work.
Safely and quickly respond to and leads an onsite incident response team for all abnormal conditions that impact operations, and coordinates with other critical facilities professionals to perform corrective repairs, without supervision.
Enhance, develop new or follow preexisting emergency operating procedures (EOPs), methods of procedure (MOPs), and standard operating procedures (SOPs) in relation to CE operations and incidents.
Equipment and Systems Maintenance
Under minimal oversight, perform various types of maintenance (e.g., planned, predictive, corrective) and repairs following methods of procedure (MOPs), and standard operating procedures (SOPs) for one or more types of equipment (e.g., electrical, mechanical, cooling systems), correct procedures and equipment, and escalate when appropriate. Serve as a subject matter expert for 1+ types of equipment.
Have a hands-on understanding of how equipment works within disciplines they have been trained and how to troubleshoot equipment, systems, subsystems, and components independently within their trained discipline(s).
Coordinate and schedule supplier/vendor on-site activities and recognizes circumstances when to stop supplier work to address potential and/or identified concerns.
Takes part in getting third-party work underway (e.g., making sure systems are properly energized/deenergized), ensuring the work is started and completed in a safe manner in accordance with standard practices, procedures, federal/local legislation, and municipal codes.
Provides consultation to lower-level colleagues in troubleshooting systems and problems.
Critical Environment Culture
Understands, follows, and ensures safety and security requirements (e.g., job hazard assessments [JHAs], toolbox talks), and business processes and procedures to properly perform work in a safe, quality, and reliable manner in accordance with applicable federal, state, local, and Microsoft requirements.
Maintain safe working conditions and escalate immediately when unsafe working conditions are observed.
Assesses and identifies appropriate resources and equipment necessary to fully support environmental health and safety (EH&S) objectives.
Participates in required meetings, trainings, and necessary handoffs.
Other
Embody our culture and values
Qualifications

Required Qualifications:
High School Diploma, GED, or equivalent.
Mission critical services work/applied learning experience (e.g., high availability assembly / manufacturing / critical infrastructure environments such as data centers, oil and gas refineries, hospitals, pharmaceutical, manufacturing, or related fields)
Or equivalent experience.
To promote health and safety in the workplace, employees are subject to required health related screenings, such as hearing testing, which includes both baseline testing and annual retests, where permitted by applicable law.
Ability to work shifts, including shift assignments during non-standard business hours that may include evening, nighttime, weekends, and/or holidays
While not required, we also look for the following Preferred Qualifications:
High School Diploma, GED, or equivalent AND years of mission critical services experience (e.g., high-availability assembly/manufacturing/critical infrastructure environments such as data centers, oil and gas refineries, hospitals, pharmaceutical, manufacturing, or related fields)
OR, Associate degree or technical trade certification (e.g., military, trade school), or higher-equivalent education.
Background Check Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:
Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.
#COICareers

Qualifications

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

This role supports the Finance transformation initiatives around reporting automation, including Power BI (design and building new reports, maintenance of the tool), and management of the SAP BPC tool, working closely with the Systems team .
In addition, the role also supports the analysis of all our Overhead spend $50m and provides crucial insights to corporate costs to Functional leads.
This critical function acts as an intermediary between Finance, IT and the Corporate functions, prepares the spend analysis around actuals, budget and costs forecasts of those functions.
The person hired for this role must have a proven record of partnering with senior stakeholders. The role reports into Finance but has a dotted line to Director of Finance Transformation. job description:
About the job
As Finance Analyst, you will act as the key business support for the dedicated business units with revenue budgeting, forecasting, reporting, pricing, and profitability projects. This role will be responsible for the Iberia region.

Some of the accountabilities of this role are:

Prepare monthly management reporting packages per product & country with relevant management commentary
Prepare country pack presentations
Partner with Country General Managers and Commercial Teams in evaluating new business opportunities in dedicated business units
Supporting the adoption of standard finance tools and processes
Combining FP&A data analytics with business insights to produce accurate budgets and forecasts and clearly measure and communicate performance against these
Perform customer profitability review
Analyze and identify the reasons for variations
Control and analysis of direct costs of dedicated business units.
Participation in current department projects and other tasks

What we look for:

3+ years of Finance experience preferably for complex multinational businesses, with Commercial and Supply Chain Finance expertise
Established financial, commercial, and strategic analysis skills.
Excellent data management skills.
Base level financial modelling skills (DCF Analysis, scenario analysis, business case development, business valuations, and operational modelling).
Commercial acumen with demonstrated strength in solving both structured and unstructured problems.
Advanced Word / Excel / PowerPoint skills.

Languages
English and Spanish fluency

job description:
About the job
Join a thriving environment tasked with delivering new and disruptive technologies!

As a Security Architect you will take the lead in designing and overseeing the implementation and management our organization‚Äôs technical security solutions. You will be part of a team building cutting edge technology solutions and ensuring security measures are layered into the solution designs. You will also work with our infrastructure and compliance teams to identify and oversee the implementation of security controls to prevent, detect and mitigate security threats.

As a security expert, you will be across trends in security threats and solutioning and be able to provide pragmatic advice to stakeholders on how to best manage these risks. So, if coming up with great ideas on how to ensure effective security solutioning in an innovative and high-performing company is your thing, we have just the job for you.

The role:

Work closely with the business managers, product owners, support function and technical leads to provide technical guidance and innovative designs for ensuring we meet high levels of security in our products and services, while minimizing the impact on customer experience and business value creation.
Lead the continuous testing and monitoring of security controls throughout the product build cycle and into production, including across our internal infrastructure.
Provide technical advice on Disaster Recovery (DR) solutioning and Business Continuity Planning (BCP).
Work with our leadership team and other security and risk management specialist to identify innovative and pragmatic approaches to maintain and improve our overall security.
Assist with the formation of security policies and procedures that support our security posture.

Who are you?

You are excited by future trends in technology, especially at the thought of working with 3D immersive communication channels.
You are a technical expert in security who loves a challenge.
You are a creative thinker, with the ability to understand existing security threats and requirements and map them onto ground-breaking new digital solutions in a practical manner.
You are an effective communicator who can influence other leaders and drive decisions relating to security solutioning.
You are a self-motivated technology specialist who can work independently while also engaging closely with colleagues to drive outcomes.
You pay attention to details and hold yourself and others accountable to delivering set results.

What we are looking for:

5+ years of technical security solutioning and design experience, preferably in an enterprise-size organization.
Demonstrated detailed technical knowledge of security layering, cryptography, authentication, authorization and general security protocols.
Specific experience implementing multi-factor authentication, single-sign-on, identity management and related technologies.
Solid understanding of business continuity and disaster recovery concepts.
A willingness and skill to work, write, talk, and present in English.

The cherry on top!

Previous experience in healthcare and banking industries.
Speaking any additional languages.

Feeling inspired?

Start your application with us today by sending your resume!

Not quite what you were looking for? We offer hybrid job opportunities in multiple locations and might just have the perfect fit for you at The TMRW Foundation! All open applications can be sent to recruitment@tmrw.com.

job description:
About the job
Valeo est une entreprise mondiale de haute technologie qui con√ßoit des solutions r√©volutionnaires pour r√©inventer la mobilit√©. Nous sommes un √©quipementier partenaire des constructeurs automobiles et des acteurs de la nouvelle mobilit√© dans le monde entier. Notre vision ? Inventer une mobilit√© plus verte et plus s√ªre, gr√¢ce √† des solutions ax√©es sur la conduite intuitive et la r√©duction des √©missions de CO2. Nous sommes leaders dans nos domaines d'activit√© et reconnus comme l'une des plus grandes entreprises innovantes au monde.

Valeo Group is one of the world's largest Automotive suppliers which is an inspired company focused on innovative products, development and customer satisfaction. Working with us means managing the most advanced and sophisticated technologies.

Our Martos plant is one of the biggest sites within our Visibility Systems Business Group in charge of developing and manufacturing Lighting Products and Electronics, with around 3.000 employees. From the latest adaptive lighting technologies to intuitive interior lighting solutions to stylish and design-centric external lighting, Valeo constantly innovates to improve comfort and safety for drivers and passengers alike.

As a Test & Validation Design Leader in Valeo Martos you will have the opportunity to work with the most powerful carmaker companies, in the electronics development working in an international and multicultural environment.

Mission~

The test & validation leader is responsible to build the Design Validation & review (DV&R), to conduct overall product test and validation activities (including electronic contents) within R&D team, all along the project, from RFQ phase to last validation phases. Also to ensure product conformity and robustness.

Your responsibilities~

Define the product test strategy based on Customer and Valeo standards specifications and risk analysis (PCA, PHA, DFMEA, R&D Metiers Fix-Variable-Specific analysis).
Support the project team for compatibility matrix & risk analysis, with contribution of the product family validation standard owner up from the project acquisition phase.
Documents Design Validation plan including environmental validation test plan and functional validation test plan with the product architect, based on defined test strategy.
Plan & quotate at CAA (Contract Application Approval) with the R&D Project Team Member all necessary actions to run the Design Validation as~ number of parts, jiggs, subcomponents, headcount, test bench costs (characterization, reliability), potential external test costs.
Secure that validation conditions & planning feasibility are within project commitments~
Validation data (technical and system requirements, simulation reports, technical inputs for testing‚Ä¶) to be supplied by the product architect and metier design leaders
Labs means availability (tests equipment, mission profiles, skills, certified suppliers for sub contracting tests)
State that test prerequisites checklist are documented with part level maturity at each DV step.
Coordinates all product integrations and validation activities (regulations, functional, system, optics, mechanics, EE tests including EMC, craftsmanship, vehicle tests), whatever the laboratory involved, whatever if managed internally or externally to supply the validation deliverables.
Secure reports archiving in TMT.
Report issues at the first level of analysis and progress through Design Validation & Review dashboard (KPIs).
Reports project validation risks assessment to the R&D PTM in Design Validation phase.
Responsible of RAISE Validation metier review management.
Capitalize on product risks and reports all capitalization data to the product family Test & Validation standard owner.
Release the DV&R with validation status to be approved by the Test & Validation Manager and provide the design validation & review report to the R&D PTM .

Desired skills and experience~

Master in engineering (general technical engineering knowledge~ embedded electronics, mechanics, software, optical system )
Experience~ 3 to 7 years in testing of embedded product (functional and/or Environmental) and experience in project development/validation management required
Advanced level of English
Passion for the automotive industry.

If you DO NOT meet all the requirements, don't worry, we want to meet you too!

Come to Valeo and discover our benefits! We offer our employees~


The chance to profit from a customized career plan in one of the most important tech-companies worldwide!
The possibility of knowing everything you need about Valeo and your new challenging position with a comprehensive integration plan and a customized buddy program

job description:
About the job
About Vermut

Vermut is a community marketplace of unique experiences for seniors. The market is huge and no-one is paying attention to create an overall solution for the pains and desires of our older adults. We are building ‚Äòthe place to be for seniors‚Äô. The company was set up at the end of 2020, and we‚Äôve already proven market fit in Spain and we are planning to double down to Spain and Europe, scaling fast and building from the bottom-up.

The Data team is responsible for building the environment that enables data-driven decision-making and progress measuring. You will be impacting how the whole company executes thanks to your insights. The data team is small and the opportunity to learn and grow from it is huge. If you like to see how working with data impacts the day to day of a company, this position should move you.

Ownership

Build all the company dashboards, and maintain the connections and the logic behind the current ones (Build and maintain data pipelines from DB to dashboards and reports)
Build the structure of data flows between platforms and own the relationship with the Engineering team.
Build correlations and draw conclusions based on analysis (ex. customer retention, demand planning).
Help scale the Ops, Marketing, and Sales teams with processes and projects on-demand.
Help the CEO and Finance team with scaling the financial forecasting.

What we are looking for

Degree in Engineering, Maths, Data or similar
Highly data driven and analytical mindset
Problem-solving skills and execution focus
Comfortable working with high-intensity environments
Technical skills
SQL knowledge
DataStudio or other visualization tool knowledge
Understand our values and be able to embrace them:
- Passion for what you do. Dedication and commitment to excel at your job.
- User first. Empathy towards covering their needs and creating value.
- Constant feedback. Honest and proper constructive criticism is what makes us innovate fast as a company.
- We are still humans. Your health and peace is important in order to shine at your job, do not forget.

Benefits

International and smart team.
Blank sheet to create and build from scratch.
Monthly gatherings and optimistic company culture.
Free Vermut activities.
Hybrid work culture (but with preference in on-site working - Barcelona, Spain)

job description:
About the job
We Believe in Better!

We are a global information technology company that builds high-performance, security-centric solutions that can help change the world. Enhancing people‚Äôs lives through secure, reliable advanced technology is our vision.

At Unisys, we believe in better! Here, you have the opportunity to learn new skills, apply your expertise, and solve complex problems with cutting edge technologies and solutions. You are part of a global diverse team that supports you, drives change, and delivers successful results consistently.

Our associates are at the forefront of everything we do, driving our clients‚Äô successes while giving back to communities and making this world a safer and more secure place to live and work. Our success is a direct result of the work of our people who live and breathe our Core Beliefs. Simply put, we believe in better lives. Join us!

Learn more about Unisys and our key solution offerings: Unisys, Stealth‚Ñ¢, CloudForte¬Æ, InteliServe‚Ñ¢

What success looks like in this role:

This role is subject to Unisys billing rates, productivity, utilization and total chargeability metrics. Only billable/direct client chargeable employees are to be placed in this role. Designs or modifies business processes and the corresponding information technology solutions. Performs analysis of business and user needs, documenting requirements, researching gaps and providing process and/or development solutions. Acts as liaison between the business users and IT. Makes recommendations to address specific business needs for information technology based solutions. Collaborates with multiple cross-functional areas externally and internally in the implementation of system and business processes. Defines system scope and objectives as well as the content of required documentation. Evaluates new software products to determine their applicability to current and future IT environments. Manages vendor relationships including issue notifications and follow-up until resolution. Evaluates new applications and identifies systems requirements. Evaluates new IT developments and evolving business requirements and recommends appropriate systems alternatives and/or enhancements to current systems. Prepares communications and makes presentations on system enhancements and/or alternatives. Developing professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues. Applies theories, concepts, principles, and methodologies to difficult but conventional assignments. Works independently within an established framework. Provides problem resolution that may be non-standard within defined practices and procedures. Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. Builds productive internal/external working relationships. Normally receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments. Has working knowledge and experience in own discipline. Continues to build knowledge of the organization, processes and customers. Performs a range of mainly straightforward assignments. Uses prescribed guidelines or policies to analyze and resolve problems. Receives a moderate level of guidance and direction.

Key Responsibilities
Participate in joint application design sessions to collect new business requirements.
Identify and develop use cases based on client requirements.
Verify requirements through analysis, test, demonstration and inspection.
Analyze business processes/systems, identify inefficiencies and required controls, document procedures, and track KPI‚Äôs.
Collaborate with internal and external users/customers to elicit business concerns and develop workable solutions.
Participate in planning initiatives, feasibility studies, cost/benefit analysis, and new systems design.
Work with the QA team to prepare test scenarios and data.
Document and manage business and functional requirements.
Review user stories and acceptance criteria.
Provide thought leadership in one of the functional areas, handle queries and competency building in respective functional area.
Provide functional solution and clarification on the inter-module dependencies.
Determine a project‚Äôs requirements by extracting them from business or government policies, as well as from current and future users, through interaction and research.
Anticipate future requirements to ensure successful outcomes.
Constrain requirements when necessary and focus on core business needs, rather than users‚Äô personal preferences, functions related to trends or outdated processes, or other non-essential modifications.
Organize requirements into related categories to effectively manage and communicate them.
Use powerful analysis and modeling tools to match strategic business objectives with practical technical solutions.
At regular intervals in the project life cycle, safeguard and protect the business and user‚Äôs needs by verifying functionality, accuracy and completeness of the requirements against the original documents. Safeguarding minimizes risk by ensuring requirements are being met before investing further in system development.
Emphasize simplicity and ease of use at all times, especially in implementation.

In application maintenance the focus is on preventing and correcting defects; enhancements, or making changes to increase the value provided by the system.

You will be successful in this role if you have:

Key Qualifications
Requires a Bachelor‚Äôs degree and a minimum of 2 years of related experience; or an advanced degree without experience, or equivalent work experience

job description:
About the job
Company Summary

Product Madness is a Global Powerhouse where the greatest mobile games and experiences are crafted by world-class talent. A top-grossing leader in free to play mobile games, we have more than 800 team members working across seven global talent hubs including London (headquarters), USA, Canada, Spain, Poland and Ukraine. With remarkable hit games including Heart of Vegas, Cashman Casino, Lighting Link and Big Fish Casino, we boast more than 50 million active users and 400 million downloads and counting.

We are Mad about games and the way they bring people together, and that passion and culture is what brings us together as a studio, connects us with our partners we collaborate with, and is what links us to our sister studios across the world.

Product Madness is an Aristocrat Technologies company within its digital game‚Äôs division of Pixel United.

Job Posting Title

Data Analyst

Summary

We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our sunny Barcelona office as a Data/Product Analyst. You will be working together with other product analysts and data scientists embedded in our games team. You will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning product data from big datasets. Thus, covering the full scope of data mining to reporting. In addition you will also be responsible to show the impact of product data via dashboards and/or other means of visualisations to key stakeholders throughout the company.

What You'll Do

Why this role?

This role is intended to strengthen the craft of analytics in Product Madness and to ensure the game teams are making informed decisions based on actionable insights. Your key responsibilities will be:

Working closely with product and the game teams, implement tracking in games to capture player data and create reports that give further insight into player behaviour and product performance.
Form new insights and perspectives that inform decisions and help us continue to delight the people playing our games.
Produce reports and deliver insights that have an impact on the future direction of our games and the game roadmap.
Work with game teams and DWH to produce end to end data pipelines that empower end users.
Work closely with product and game teams to create reports and monitoring of daily KPIs.
Investigating issues in the Production environment, analysing and optimising existing product features and A/B tests.
Apply creative thinking towards designing, testing, verifying, and implementing solutions.


Why should you join us?

As well we having the ability to grow and develop your career and work for a people first business that looks after all employees, you will also get some amazing benefits + an outstanding salary

25 days per year + Christmas closure + BCN Bank Holidays + Birthday off
Flexibility of 1 hours at the start and end of the working day + Summer working hours
Yearly bonus scheme
Fully hybrid working arrangements to suit you
50‚Ç¨ Amazon voucher for your birthday
40‚Ç¨ via Uber Eats voucher every month - have a take a way on us
WFH allowance of 250‚Ç¨ (one off) to set up your home office
Cigna - Medical Insurance for all our employees.
GYMPASS - free gym membership
Basket of Fruit worth 25‚Ç¨ each month of fruit and veggies sent to your house.
F&B provided at designated PM Games/Social Nights
Referral Scheme of 5000‚Ç¨ per referral hired (to be paid after successful completion of probation period)


What We're Looking For

What we look for in you

Previous experience in a product or data analyst role
Strong SQL and Excel skills
Experience of standard reporting tools such as Looker/QlikView/Tableau/Power BI etc.
Working experience setting up and analyzing A/B-tests would be desirable
Strong in mathematics and quantitative analysis with a passion for numbers and data
Interested in gaming and the mobile game industry, any experience in these industries would be highly desirable
Fluent in English
A Masters degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or a analytical field is preferred
Experience with Python and/or R would be ideal but not essential


Why Product Madness?

Product Madness is so much more than just a Pool table and a foosball game.

We believe in an honest and transparent approach with our teammates. Company wide weekly Town Halls, All Hands and strategy meetings are just a few ways in which we encourage an open and honest path to achieving complete transparency.

Despite a pandemic, there isn‚Äôt a day where we don‚Äôt feel connected to one another.

With frequent events, workshops, giveaways, slack coffee and donut sessions we have definitely brought on our office culture to this new virtual world of zoom calls.

We also try to cater for all our staff‚Äôs needs ‚Äì be that a freshly brewed cappuccino made by our professional barista in our free coffee shop or by providing a bountiful supply of tasty snacks to keep us refueled and buzzing.

We love to organise plenty of social get-togethers and action-packed activity days, be it slipping inside an inflatable bumper ball for a mad session of football zorbing or throwing caution to the wind and traversing giddy treetop rope courses at Go Ape. On top of these team-building activities, our lunch and learn workshops, not to mention the lavish Christmas and summer parties, foster that ‚Äòwork hard, play hard‚Äô mantra. Our offices are based in the heart of the metropolises of London and Lviv, surrounded by an abundance of diversity and inspiration to keep those ideas flowing.

Our Values

People First


We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More


Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world‚Äôs best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive


We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused


We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

job description:
About the job
Description

Are you a driven and analytical savvy Data Analyst? Do you enjoy working with large data sets and applying analytics skills to answer business questions? Then we are looking for you!

We are looking for a Senior Product Analyst to help evolve one of our leading game franchises, Stumble Guys. As a Senior Product Analyst you will join a team of Analytical Engineers and Data Analysts, and will be working closely with the product team. In this role, partnering with our internal data platform and data science teams, you will use data to generate player behaviour insights and improve feature performance; from data modelling and event tracking, through to AB-testing, insightful analyses and recommendations that answers Stumble Guys most complex and challenging questions.

It is your chance to join a brand new Stumble Guys Analytics team and take part in framework creation and product decision making shaping future development of the game.

What You Will Do

Analyze large, complex data sets representing the behaviour of millions of online and mobile game players to address strategic and operational business questions
Own the insights to drive the needle moving improvements by working with the entire organization from engineering to marketing
Develop frameworks, models, and tools to ensure data influences decisions at all levels
Provide actionable recommendations and conclusions from mobile / game data to shape features, game performance, game economies and future product roadmaps.
Present your findings to cross functional team members in a presentation setting

What You Will Need

Passion for continuous learning in a fast-paced, highly-collaborative environment
Excellent English communication skills, written and oral
Intellectual curiosity and analytical rigor
Experience in a highly analytical business environment
Working knowledge of SQL and comfort working in large data sets ‚Äì exposure with BigQuery and/or Looker a plus. Python/R experience a plus

What We Offer

Career-defining opportunity to put your stamp on the future of mobile gaming, working and growing alongside a collectively ambitious diverse cross-functional team.
Competitive salary plus bonus funded by company performance.
Flexible working schedule with options for hybrid and remote work.
Comprehensive package of employment benefits including health insurance and meal vouchers (among others).

About us:

Scopely is a leading mobile games company home to many top-grossing, award-winning franchises including Star Trek‚Ñ¢ Fleet Command, Looney Tunes‚Ñ¢ World of Mayhem, WWE Champions 2019, The Walking Dead: Road To Survival‚Ñ¢, YAHTZEE¬Æ With Buddies and Wheel of Fortune¬Æ: Free Play, among others. Scopely creates rewarding, immersive games that empower a directed-by-consumer experience. Founded in 2011, Scopely is fueled by a world-class team and a proprietary technology platform that personalizes gameplay at scale across one of the most diversified portfolios in the west. Recognized in Fast Company‚Äôs ‚ÄòWorld‚Äôs Most Innovative Companies‚Äô and #2 on Deloitte‚Äôs ‚ÄòTechnology Fast 500‚Äô as one of the fastest-growing companies in North America, Scopely has achieved more than $1 billion in lifetime revenue by creating game experiences that are an important part of people‚Äôs lives. With global operations in Los Angeles, Barcelona and Dublin (DIGIT Games Studios), and additional studios in seven countries across four continents, Scopely has raised more than $250 million in financing from global entertainment and technology investors.

Scopely is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, family or parental status, gender identity, veteran, or disability status, or other protected status.
